王子は心身ともにご無事であったと
聞いています

MsgEn: Good--really good.
MsgJp: 良かった――本当に良かった

MsgEn:
Prince Nedo is safe—
and moreover, I hear he is an Arisen.
However, he has a suspicious personality.
MsgJp:
ネド王子はご無事――
しかも覚者であると聞いていますが
なにぶん、疑い深い性格でしてね

MsgEn: After finishing the defense of this area, I will also hurry to the prince's side.
MsgJp:
この地の守備固めの算段を終えたら
わたしも王子の下へ馳せ参じましょう

MsgEn: While the focus tends to be only on the infected monsters, the condition of plants and soil is also dire.
MsgJp:
敵の攻勢に対処しつつ“悪しき竜”を
倒す方法も模索しなくてはなりません

MsgEn: Even though it may not look like it, I am also a martial artist. There is no need to worry about me being wishy-washy.
MsgJp:
こう見えてわたしも武闘派
弱腰になる心配など無用ですよ

MsgEn: There is no problem here. Please serve Prince Nedo.
MsgJp:
こちらは問題ありませんよ
ネド王子のお側に仕えてください

MsgEn: There is no problem here, please serve Prince Nedo.
MsgJp:
こちらは問題ありませんよ
ネド王子のお側に仕えてください

MsgEn: The enemy will be completely occupied with us. Yes, we will be very flashy!
MsgJp:
敵は我々が目一杯引きつけますから
ええ、派手にやりますとも

MsgEn: Now is the time to commend and give rest to the soldiers. Please wait a little while.
MsgJp:
今は兵達を労い、休ませる時です
今少し、時間をください

MsgEn: Have you heard the rumors about the knight wearing jet-black armor?
MsgJp:
漆黒の鎧をまとった騎士のうわさは
聞きましたかな？

MsgEn: The Royal Capital fell because of the appearance of that person, or so I've heard. Well, I don't know anything beyond that.
MsgJp:
その者が現れたことで王都は陥落したとか
いや、それ以上のことは知らないのですが

MsgEn: Preparations for deployment are complete. However, we have yet to receive orders.
MsgJp:
出撃の準備は整っています
しかし、まだ命令が届きませんのでね

MsgEn: Despite the war, the reason why our voices were not heard is because we were told to wait as the second arrow.
MsgJp:
大戦にも関わらず声が掛からなかったのは
我々は第二の矢として待機せよということ

MsgEn: Until then, let's sharpen our arrowheads here.
MsgJp: その時までここで矢尻を研いでおきましょう

MsgEn: It seems that the capture of the royal capital ended in failure.
MsgJp: 王都の攻略は失敗に終わったそうですね

MsgEn: We pray for the repose of those who perished here.
MsgJp:
わたしたちはここで散った者たちの
安息を祈っています

MsgEn: I am glad that you stopped by, but it would be reassuring if you could stay by the side of Prince Nedo and General Meirova.
MsgJp:
立ち寄ってくれたことはうれしいのですが
ネド王子とメイロワ将軍のそばに
いてあげてくれると安心なのですがね

MsgEn: If you guys are here, does that mean it's all settled on the other side?
MsgJp:
あなたたちがここにいるということは
向こうは一件落着でしょうか？

MsgEn: No, it doesn't look like—
MsgJp: いいえ、そうは見えませんね――

MsgEn:
I think it's time for us to head out.
We're going even if we don't get the orders to go.
MsgJp:
そろそろ我々も出陣しましょうかな
たとえ命令がなくても行くつもりですよ

MsgEn: The disappearance of the prince is not a simple case of running away from home.
MsgJp:
王子の失踪は、ただの家出騒動では
ありません

MsgEn: The prince is the future of Acre Selund, after all.
MsgJp:
王子はアッカーシェランの未来そのもの
なのですからね

MsgEn: It is inconceivable that the prince would abandon his position. I only believe in him!
MsgJp:
王子がお立場を棄てることは考えられない
わたしはただただ王子を信じるのみです

MsgEn:
I can't just stand still,
I'll stand on the front line too.
MsgJp:
ジッとしてなどいられませんね
わたしも最前線に立たせてもらいますよ

MsgEn: As soon as preparations are complete, I plan to hasten to the prince's side.
MsgJp:
準備が整い次第、王子のところへ
馳せ参じるつもりです

MsgEn: Thank you all for your hard work. I will pray every day that you have peace for the rest of your lives.
MsgJp:
皆さんお疲れさまでした
残りの人生を平穏に送れるように
わたしは日々祈るつもりです

MsgEn: Everyone's share―― No, no, is that really any of your business?
MsgJp:
皆さんのぶんも――いやいや、それは
余計なお世話ですかな

MsgEn: When my voice is loud and annoying, or on the contrary, when it's so quiet that you can't hear, let me know.
MsgJp:
声がでかくてうるさかったり、反対に、小さくて
聞こえない時はそう言っておくれ

MsgEn:
It's all a habit.
Thieves, you see, work in all kinds of situations.
MsgJp:
こればっかりは習い性でね
盗賊は、ほら、いろんな状況で仕事をするからさ

MsgEn: Everyone knows my name, but not everyone knows my face.
MsgJp:
あたしの名前は誰でも知ってるけど、顔を知っている
人間はそういないよ

MsgEn: If possible, I would have preferred to stay as it was, but well, I can't just keep saying that.
MsgJp:
できればずっとそのままが良かったけど
まあ、そうも言ってられないね

MsgEn:
I was imprisoned because I ignored my son's opinion.
I felt so much remorse while I was in jail.
MsgJp:
あたしが投獄されたのは息子の意見を
無視したからなんだ
牢屋の中で、ずいぶん反省したよ

MsgEn: That's why I'm such a good listener now.
MsgJp: それで今の、聞き分けのいいあたしがいるのさ

MsgEn: Don't think I'm just an old lady.
MsgJp: 婆さんだと思ってなめるんじゃないよ？

MsgEn: Any old man out there, five of them could come at you and you wouldn't bat an eye.
MsgJp:
そのへんの爺さんなら５人でかかってきても
目じゃないさ

MsgEn: I hate authority
MsgJp: あたしは権威ってのが大キライでね

MsgEn:
But then I realized, I'm like the authority in the bandit world.
Oh, I can't wait!
MsgJp:
でも、気づいたら
あたしが盗賊界の権威みたいなものさ
ああ、たまらないよ

MsgEn: So, we need the dragons and royalty to stay strong.
MsgJp:
だから、竜と王族には強くあってもらわないと
困るんだ

MsgEn: Not that I'm going to do anything about this, but you do have treasures in Lestania, don't you?
MsgJp:
これを聞いたからってどうするわけでもないけど
レスタニアにもお宝はあるんだろう？

MsgEn: Most likely, the goblins are hoarding them.
MsgJp:
大方、ゴブリンあたりが
ため込んでいるんじゃないかい？

MsgEn: If you live long enough, unexpected things happen.
MsgJp: 長く生きると、想像もしなかったことが起こるよ

MsgEn: The whole Evil Dragon thing is a big deal, but I can't believe I'm working with Meirova.
MsgJp:
悪しき竜のことはそりゃあ一大事だけど
あたしがメイロワと手を組むなんてねえ

MsgEn:
I've never seen these materials used in your equipment--
I'd love to visit Lestania when you get settled!
MsgJp:
あんたたちの装備には見たことのない材料が
使われているね――
落ち着いたら、ぜひ、レスタニアへ行ってみたいね

MsgEn: Just so you know I only steal royal treasures.
MsgJp:
言っておくけどね
あたしが盗むのは王家のお宝だけさ

MsgEn:
But that doesn't mean I'm a righteous bandit.
I don't like charity.
MsgJp:
でも義賊というわけじゃない
施しは好きじゃないからね

MsgEn: I'm sure my sons are fighting somewhere too.
MsgJp: あたしの息子たちもどこかで戦っているんだろうね

MsgEn:
Well, just stay safe and that's all that matters.
As long as you're alive, you can enjoy being a bandit again.
MsgJp:
まあ、無事でいてくれればそれでいいんだ
生きていれば、また盗賊稼業を楽しめるさ

MsgEn: Yeah, what about me?
MsgJp: うん、あたしかい？

MsgEn: You didn't come here to help me, did you?
MsgJp:
別にあたしを助けに来たわけじゃ
ないだろう？

MsgEn: Ah, I don't mind. So, what about General Meirova?
MsgJp:
ああ、構いやしないよ
で、メイロワ将軍はなんだって？

MsgEn: If that old man bows his head, there's nothing he won't do to help the Liberation Army. Please relay this.
MsgJp:
あの爺さんが頭を下げれば
解放軍に協力しないことはない
伝えといてくれ

MsgEn: Prince Nedo, aren't you trying too hard? Oh dear, are you okay?
MsgJp:
ネド王子、気張りすぎじゃないのかい？
ありゃ、大丈夫かね

MsgEn: Anyway, if the enemy manages to come this far, there's nothing we can do.
MsgJp:
とにかくね、敵にここまで来られたら
どうしようもないよ

MsgEn: Remember that and keep fighting.
MsgJp: それを忘れずに戦っておくれ

MsgEn: It seems that the prince is feeling better after confronting the "evil dragon."
MsgJp:
“悪しき竜”と対峙したことで王子はどうやら
気持ちが大きくなっているようだ

MsgEn: This is a dangerous sign.
MsgJp: これは危険な兆候だよ

MsgEn: Entrances, corridors, the royal family has a lot to hide.
MsgJp: 入り口だ通路だと王家は隠し事が多いね

MsgEn: That's what we're looking forward to uncovering.
MsgJp:
それを暴くのがわたしたちの
楽しみなんだけどさ

MsgEn: Entrances, corridors, the royal family has a lot to hide.
MsgJp: 入り口だ通路だと王家は隠し事が多いね

MsgEn:
That's what we're looking forward to
uncovering.
MsgJp:
それを暴くのがわたしたちの
楽しみなんだけどさ

MsgEn: I've snuck into the castle many times before, but this is my first time sneaking in and attacking.
MsgJp:
城に忍び込むなんてのは何度もしたけど
斬り込んで行くなんて初めてだ

MsgEn: To be honest... my heart is pounding.
MsgJp: 正直に言って――胸がおどるよ

MsgEn: What was taken from us, one by one, we'll get back.
MsgJp:
奪われたものは、ひとつひとつ
取り戻せばいいのさ

MsgEn: As a bandit, it's not my place to say, but you know.
MsgJp: 盗賊のあたしが言うことじゃないがね

MsgEn: Because Megado is the Royal Capital, it was a very prosperous city. This is the training ground for thieves.
MsgJp:
メガドは王都だからね
それはそれは豊かな町だったよ
盗賊の修行の場さ

MsgEn: Sounds like it's going to be tricky.
MsgJp: 厄介なことになりそうだねえ

MsgEn: I'll go with the thieves from the north.
MsgJp: 北の盗賊たちと一緒にあたしも行くよ

MsgEn: What's wrong? You look pale.
MsgJp:
どうしたんだい
顔色が冴えないね

MsgEn: Oh you're back. I still need you guys. I'm worried about my back.
MsgJp:
ああ戻ったんだね
やっぱりあんたたちがいてくれないと
背中が不安だよ

MsgEn: The Liberation Army is regrouping but you know, no matter how hard we try we can't fill the hole without you guys.
MsgJp:
解放軍は再編成中さ
でもね、どんなに頑張ったって
あんたたちのいない穴は埋まらない

MsgEn: You may have your own circumstances, but please stay with me until the end.
MsgJp:
そっちにも事情はあるだろうけど
最後まで付き合ってもらうよ

MsgEn: The Evil Dragon is the only thing remaining. Although we took a little detour; Step by step, we should be cornering it.
MsgJp:
あとは“悪しき竜”だね
ちょっと遠回りしちまったけど
一歩一歩、追い詰めているはずだよ

MsgEn: Compared to when we first met, the prince has grown— that's what I thought, and just as I did, this happened.
MsgJp:
初めて会った頃に比べたら王子は
成長した――そう思った矢先のこれだよ

MsgEn: Don't act like this. It shows that you're still a child.
MsgJp:
こんな行動をするなんて
まだまだ子供だってことなんだろうね

MsgEn: Compared to when we first met, the prince has grown— that's what I thought, and just as I did, this happened.
MsgJp:
初めて会った頃に比べたら王子は
成長した――そう思った矢先のこれだよ

MsgEn: Don't act like this. It shows that you're still a child.
MsgJp:
こんな行動をするなんて
まだまだ子供だってことなんだろうね

MsgEn: Thanks for taking care of the grandchildren.
MsgJp: 孫たちが世話になったね

MsgEn: Oops-- I can't believe I'm resorting to such a clichéd gesture. I guess I'm getting old.
MsgJp:
おっと――
こんな月並みな礼をしちまうとは
あたしも歳を取ったねえ

MsgEn: The absence of the prince has started to become a rumor, you know. But just leave it alone.
MsgJp:
王子の不在が噂になり始めたよ
あんたらの耳にも入ると思うけど
放っておきな

MsgEn: I'll take care of it.
MsgJp: あたしがなんとかするからさ

MsgEn:
Life is really unpredictable.
You never know what will happen.
MsgJp:
人生ってのはほんと気紛れだね
何が起こるかわからない

MsgEn: Oh, even at this age, there are still many surprising things happening.
MsgJp:
ああ、この歳になっても
驚くようなことはまだまだいっぱい起こるよ

MsgEn:
The inside of the castle is quiet.
Everyone is reflecting on themselves.
MsgJp:
城内は静かなものさ
みんな自分を見つめ直しているんだろうね

MsgEn: The prince must be an important person, but the hero is one of the liberation army too. You can't think only about the prince.
MsgJp:
王子は重要人物には違いないけど
主人公は解放軍のひとりひとりだ
王子のことばかり思っちゃいられないさ

MsgEn: I heard a rumor about what happened to Phindym's dragon.
MsgJp:
フィンダムの竜に起こったことを
小耳に挟んだよ

MsgEn: Sounds like it would be better to go to Phindym and talk to them.
MsgJp:
フィンダムへ行って、話を聞いた方が
良さそうだね

MsgEn: I'm not good at chit chat. -- sorry.
MsgJp:
雑談は苦手でな
――悪いな

MsgEn: Did I not say it? - I'm not a fun person to chat with.
MsgJp:
言わなかったかな――
わたしは楽しい雑談相手ではない

MsgEn: Being looked down upon by others is just about right.
MsgJp: 人からは見下されるくらいが丁度良い――

MsgEn: My own philosophy, but few people understand it. What about you?
MsgJp:
わたしなりの哲学だが、理解者は少ない
おまえはどうだ？

MsgEn: My parents were people whose personalities were as different as night and day— as different as the sky and the sea.
MsgJp:
わたしの両親は性格が昼と夜――空と海ほどに
性格が違う人たちだった

MsgEn: I get along with my mother but sometimes I wonder if we're just day and night.
MsgJp:
わたしは母とうまが合ったが
はて昼だろうか夜だろうかと時々思うのだ

MsgEn: I do not deny that suffering has brought us together. I cannot deny that suffering has made us stronger.
MsgJp:
苦難が我々を結びつけたことは否定しない
苦難が我々を強くしたことも否定はできない

MsgEn: However, if there is any meaning to this situation, wouldn't it be something like that?
MsgJp:
しかし――この状況に意味があるとすれば
それくらいだと思わないか？

MsgEn: Let's hear what you have to say.
MsgJp: ああ、用件を聞こうか

MsgEn: When you finish your task, you can go back to your country. It's too much work for us now to even keep an eye on you.
MsgJp:
用がすんだら国へ帰れ
今の我々には監視すら負担になる

MsgEn: The words of Master White Dragon—I cannot let even a single word pass me by.
MsgJp:
風が吹いてきた――
これは追い風だ――ああ、感じるぞ

MsgEn: The flow has changed since the general returned. That's the kind of person he is.
MsgJp:
将軍が戻ってから流れが変わったな
そういう人なんだよ、あの人は

MsgEn:
I wonder if Gillian is standing up to it well.
She's not exactly a great negotiator.
MsgJp:
ジリアンはうまく立ち回っているだろうか
交渉上手というわけではないからな――

MsgEn: I can't believe the prince is in the care of bandits. I'm sure the general is not at peace with that.
MsgJp:
王子が盗賊の世話になるとはね
将軍も心中穏やかではないだろうな

MsgEn: Should we prepare to receive the bandits?
MsgJp:
盗賊たちの受け入れ準備をした方が
よいのだろうか――

MsgEn: Well? Has the situation in the camp improved a bit?
MsgJp: どうだ？　少しは陣が明るくなったか？

MsgEn:
Prince Nedo said he would protect himself.
He's stubborn, but it doesn't work that way.
MsgJp:
ネド王子は、自分の身は自分で守ると
頑なだがそうはいかない

MsgEn: Please lend me your strength as well
MsgJp: あんたたちも力を貸してくれ

MsgEn: Should we fortify the defenses of Fort Thines, or should we go on an expedition searching for a stronger fortress-?
MsgJp:
このティネスの守りを固めるべきか
それとも強固な砦を求めて
遠征すべきか――

MsgEn: Hmm, let's consult with the general.
MsgJp: ふむ、将軍と相談してみようか

MsgEn: It will be difficult to reinforce the troops for a while.
MsgJp: しばらく兵の増強は難しいだろう

MsgEn: Then, we'll have to get through the harsh situation by devising a way to deploy the troops we have now.
MsgJp:
となれば、今いる兵たちの配備を
工夫して難局を乗り切らなければな

MsgEn: The number of soldiers is increasing, one by one, and three by three.
MsgJp: １人、３人と兵が増えていく

MsgEn: Every day, little by little, the people gather around Prince Nedo.
MsgJp:
日々、少しずつではあるがネド王子を慕って
民たちが集まってくるんだ

MsgEn: I'm sure Gerhard is there to make sure that everything is taken care of, but I wonder if those guys in the diversionary unit are getting a proper meal.
MsgJp:
イェルハルドがいるから抜かりはないと
思うが陽動部隊の連中はちゃんと食事を
とっているだろうか

MsgEn: I'm sure Gerhard is there to make sure that everything is taken care of, but I wonder if those guys in the diversionary unit are getting a proper meal.
MsgJp:
イェルハルドがいるから抜かりはないと
思うが陽動部隊の連中はちゃんと食事を
とっているだろうか

MsgEn: The Lookout Castle is not only a place that is dear to the royal family, but also to all of us in the Liberation Army.
MsgJp:
展望城は王家だけではなく
我々解放軍の面々にとっても思い入れのある
場所だ

MsgEn: I can't participate, but I'm counting on you.
MsgJp: わたしは参加できないが――頼むぞ

MsgEn:
I'd like to go to the castle, too, but
it's an important mission to man the fort.
MsgJp:
わたしも城へ行きたいが
砦の差配も重要な任務だからな

MsgEn: It won't be easy to reclaim the Royal Capital of Megado, but I feel like the Liberation Army can do it now.
MsgJp:
王都メガドの奪回は簡単ではないだろう
でも、今の解放軍ならやれる気がする

MsgEn:
How's it going over there?
I'll take care of things here myself.
MsgJp:
そっちの様子はどうだい？
ここの留守はまかせてくれよ

MsgEn:
I'd love to rush to the front lines, but we can't leave the fort empty.
Take care of the prince and the liberation army.
MsgJp:
最前線へ飛んで行きたいが
砦を空にするわけにはいかないのだ
王子と解放軍を頼んだぞ

MsgEn: I heard that the first attempt to retake the Royal Capital has failed.
MsgJp: 第一次王都奪回作戦は失敗したと聞く

MsgEn: I want to participate in the next mission, but I can't leave my post.
MsgJp:
次の作戦には参加したいが持ち場を
離れるわけにはいかないからな

MsgEn: Did you come to see me?
MsgJp: 顔を見に来てくれたのか？

MsgEn: That's great. Please speak to everyone and let them know.
MsgJp:
うれしいね
みんなにも声をかけてやってくれ

MsgEn: Now is an important moment in the plan to regain Megado. Please come back quickly.
MsgJp:
今はメガド奪回作戦の重要な局面のはず
さあ早く戻ってくれ

MsgEn: Is it okay not to move to Lookout Castle? Am I not needed?
MsgJp:
展望城に移らなくても良いのだろうか
わたしが必要ではないのだろうか

MsgEn: As far as I know, Prince Nedo is not here.
MsgJp:
わたしの知る限り、ここには
ネド王子は来ていない

MsgEn: Just between you and me...
MsgJp: ここだけの話――

MsgEn: Could it be that the adults around have spoiled Prince Nedo too much? No, this is just between us.
MsgJp:
周囲のおとなたちがネド王子を
甘やかしすぎたということはないだろうか
いや、ここだけの話だ

MsgEn: I hear a lot of rumors, but I'm not worried.
MsgJp:
いろいろな噂が聞こえてくるが
なに、心配はしていないさ

MsgEn: Everyone, because they are the people who do it when they need to, right.
MsgJp: 皆、やる時はやる人たちだからな

MsgEn: When we met you, our hearts were like dark seas--but now?
MsgJp:
君たちと出会った頃、わたしたちの心は
暗い海のようだったが――今はどうだ

MsgEn: Even in times of crisis, you can have faith in tomorrow!
MsgJp:
たとえ危機的な状況でも
明日を信じることができるよ

MsgEn: I am considering a plan to strengthen this fortress. Even though the evil dragon is gone, the orcs are still here.
MsgJp:
この砦の強化案を考えているんだ
悪しき竜はいなくなってもオークどもは
相変わらずだからね

MsgEn: Hey
MsgJp: やあ

MsgEn: Good weather, isn't it?
MsgJp: 良い天気だね

MsgEn: How's it going?
MsgJp: 調子はどうだ？

MsgEn: You seem to have a good arm, so I may request something else from you.
MsgJp:
腕が立つようだから
また何か依頼するかもしれない

MsgEn: I am Lady Lise's Pawn. If I don't protect her-
MsgJp:
私はリズ様のポーン
あの方は、私がお守りしなければ――

MsgEn: Lady Lise, if you could please be a little more attentive—
MsgJp:
リズ様、もう少し
そそっかしさをあらためて下されば――

MsgEn: Lord Arisen, I'm afraid I need Lady Lise's help...
MsgJp:
覚者さま、恐れながら
リズ様のお手伝いをお頼みします

MsgEn: Hey, how's it going over there? What's been happening since then?
MsgJp: おう、そっちはどうだ？　その後

MsgEn: Being able to defeat demons is not the only job of an Arisen, you know. Oh, you'll understand that soon.
MsgJp:
魔物を倒すだけが覚者の仕事じゃあねぇ
あぁ、お前もそのうち分かるぜ

MsgEn: No excuses, move your hands and feet before thinking about that.
MsgJp:
言い訳はなしだ、そんなもん考える前に
手と足を動かせよ

MsgEn:
Hey, want to make a little bet?
Nah, forget it.
MsgJp:
よう、ちょっとした賭けを――
いや、やめとくわ

MsgEn: I'll save my money and build a mansion near Kinoza's spring. That's my current dream.
MsgJp:
金をためてキノザの原泉近くに屋敷を建てるのよ
それが俺の目下の夢だ

MsgEn: A series of head-to-head battles with the strongest demons and a series of victories.
MsgJp: ばかっ強い魔物と真っ向勝負して連戦連勝

MsgEn: When I became an Arisen, I could live with that and have fun. But, I've grown tired now. What do I do from now on?
MsgJp:
覚者になった頃はそれでおもしろおかしく
暮らしていけたが、もう、飽きちまった
――これから、どうするよ

MsgEn: It's exciting, so exciting. That's what I want―― I finally understand.
MsgJp:
刺激だぜ、刺激
俺が欲しいのはそれだ――やっとわかった

MsgEn: I've always thought of myself as a lost Arisen, but in the end, I guess there's some connection somewhere. Damn it!
MsgJp:
俺はずっとはぐれ覚者のつもりでいたけどよ――
やっぱ、どっかで繋がってんだよな――ケッ！

MsgEn: I said something I shouldn't have.
MsgJp: 柄にもねえこと言っちまったぜ

MsgEn: Well, let's take it easy. There's no rush.
MsgJp:
まあ、ボチボチやろうぜ
急ぐことはねえさ

MsgEn: I intend to obey whatever you say, but don't tell me to stop gambling.
MsgJp:
あんたの言うことにはなんだって従うつもりで
いるから賭け事禁止だけは言ってくれるなよ

MsgEn: If you don't want to make a liar out of me
MsgJp: 俺をウソつきにしたくなかったらよ

MsgEn: You should at least talk to a lot of people when you're in the temple.
MsgJp: 神殿にいる時くらい、いろんな奴と話しておけよ

MsgEn: From what I've seen, when you talk to them, everyone gets happy and they all have a delighted expression on their faces.
MsgJp:
俺の見たところ、あんたに話しかけられると
どいつもこいつもうれしそうな顔になる
さぞ名誉なことに違いねえ

MsgEn: Doesn't Joseph's old man look more alive when the world is in turmoil?
MsgJp:
ジョゼフのジジイは世の中がざわついている時の方が
いきいきして見えねえか？

MsgEn: It might be a type of monster.
MsgJp: 魔物の一種かもしれねえぞ

MsgEn:
Huh... no money...
I'm screwed.
MsgJp:
はぁ――金がねえ――
負けた――

MsgEn: Huh? What's up?
MsgJp: あ？　なんだよ

MsgEn:
But--
what the hell am I--
MsgJp:
しかし――
なんだって俺が――

MsgEn: I'm a bit of an Arisen man myself, but this place is suffocating.
MsgJp:
俺も覚者の端くれだが
この場所は息が詰まるぜ

MsgEn: There's no need to say it, but I simply love a grueling fight.
MsgJp:
言うまでもねえが、俺は単純にガシガシと
戦うのが好きだ

MsgEn:
There's nothing like winning and losing with money on the line.
That's why you--
You better get me to that kind of place, and get on with it.
MsgJp:
勝敗に金がかかってるのなんて最高だぜ
そんなわけだから、おまえ――
そういう場に、さっさと俺を行かせろよ

MsgEn: Leave the eradication of the Corruption to me. I'll take care of it, no problem.
MsgJp:
侵食魔退治は俺に任せろ
ガシガシやっつけておくぜ

MsgEn: I am a man of the battlefield.
MsgJp: 俺はやっぱり戦場の男――

MsgEn: I have come to think so, but deep down in my heart, when I fight against the seemingly endless invading corruption, it feels as if my soul is about to freeze. Is this going to last forever?
MsgJp:
そう思ってきたが、こう無尽蔵にわくような
侵食魔と戦っていると心の奥底が
凍りつきそうになるぜ
永遠に続くのかよってな

MsgEn: I thought defeating the Black Knight was the end of everything. The rest is kind of a bonus, right?
MsgJp:
黒騎士を倒せば何もかも終わりじゃねえのかよ
あとはオマケみたいなものだろ？

MsgEn: If the guy who showed up on the island is our opponent from now on, we have to gather quite an elite team or we'll be done for.
MsgJp:
島に出たみたいな奴がこれからの相手だとしたら
こっちもよっぽどの精鋭を揃えないと
やられちまうぜ

MsgEn: That bastard Leo, can we afford to leave him alone?
MsgJp: レオの野郎――放って置いていいのか？

MsgEn: No matter what he says, he's a man who has abandoned his position and responsibility here. If things continue like this, it won't be satisfying in the least.
MsgJp:
口ではなんと言おうと
奴はここでの立場――責任を捨てた男だ
このままじゃあ、スカッとしねえぞ

MsgEn: What are we going to do? Is our job just to sit here and do nothing?
MsgJp:
さあどうするよ
ここでジッとしてるのが仕事か？

MsgEn: Do you think the Black Knight knows that Cecily is being hidden in the temple?
MsgJp:
セシリーが神殿に匿われていること――
黒騎士は知ってると思うか？

MsgEn: Talking to me won't change anything about the situation. You understand that, right?
MsgJp:
俺と話したって状況は何も変わらない
んなことは、わかってんだろう？

MsgEn: Don't you think it's about time to say goodbye to the infected monsters? And the black knight too, of course.
MsgJp:
侵食魔なんてのはいい加減おさらばしてえよな？
もちろん、黒騎士野郎もな

MsgEn: Leo is such an idiot, isn't he? He always looks calm, but he gets too heated. He has been like that since forever.
MsgJp:
レオはよ――バカだよな
冷めた顔して、熱くなりすぎるんだ
あいつは昔からそうだったぜ

MsgEn: I like it when it's more lively.
MsgJp: 俺はもっと賑やかなところが好きだぜ

MsgEn: It doesn't matter if they're human or monsters. It's good to have someone to make a big fuss with, whenever we feel like it.
MsgJp:
人でも魔物でも構わねえ
その気になりゃいつでも大騒ぎできる程度に
相手がいるのがいいんだ

MsgEn: The stubbornness of these people here is greater than Joseph's, but I don't feel bad about it. They have their own way of doing things.
MsgJp:
ここの連中の頭の固さはジョゼフ以上だが
悪い気はしねえな
連中なりに筋が通っている

MsgEn: -- No, I'm not talking about Joseph.
MsgJp:
――いや、ジョゼフのことをどうこう言ってる
わけじゃねえぞ

MsgEn: According to what I heard, it seems that 《Primeval Drops》is not something that can easily be obtained.
MsgJp:
聞いたところによると《原始の雫》は
そう簡単に手に入るシロモノじゃねえようだ

MsgEn:
Then you'd have to be a pretty good hand to
make a safe return, I'd think.
MsgJp:
となると、相当な手練れじゃないと
無事の帰還は難しいと思うぜ

MsgEn:
If only we'd come to Phindym a little earlier--
No more of that, huh?
MsgJp:
俺たちがもう少し早くこのフィンダムに
来ていればな――
そりゃいいっこ無しってか？

MsgEn:
I'm a Lestanian man after all.
The air feels sooooooo good coming through my nose!
MsgJp:
やっぱり俺はレスタニアの男だ
空気が鼻をスースー通ってくぜ

MsgEn: Arisen, whether sleeping or awake, it's all about fighting the Infected. My body is tired, but my mind is at ease.
MsgJp:
寝ても覚めても侵食魔退治よ
身体はキツいが気が楽っちゃあ楽だな

MsgEn: Nevertheless, enemies never seem to run out, you know? I wonder what they're actually here for. It makes me want to think about it from a philosophical perspective.
MsgJp:
しっかし、魔物ってのは尽きないよな
こいつらいったい何のためにいるんだとか
テツガク的なことも考えたくなるぜ

MsgEn: If everything goes smoothly as planned, it would be good.
MsgJp:
これで何もかも、トントン拍子に上手くいけば
いいんだがな

MsgEn: Enemies should be like enemies. Hateful and evil.
MsgJp:
敵ってのは、敵らしくあって欲しいぜ
憎らしくて、悪くてよ

MsgEn: I'll be here a little longer just to see where it all goes.
MsgJp:
もう少しここにいるぜ
行く末を見届けたくてよ

MsgEn: I thought I would be gone frequently, so I left my room. I will be living in temporary accommodations for a while.
MsgJp:
また留守がちになると思って
部屋を引き払ったぜ
しばらくは宿暮らしだ

MsgEn: Is it the Land of Despair, Acre Selund? But you know, in Gillian's eyes, there was light, wasn't there?
MsgJp:
絶望の大陸アッカーシェランか
でもよ、あのジリアンの目には
光があったよな

MsgEn: The prince said he was 12 years old; he should be old enough to think and act for himself.
MsgJp:
王子は１２歳とか言ってたな
自分の頭で考えて行動できる年頃だ

MsgEn: So, it's not like I'm just sitting still. It's troublesome, that's for sure.
MsgJp:
つまりジッとしてるわけじゃねえ
厄介っちゃあ厄介だな

MsgEn: I wonder what kind of bandits are with the prince.
MsgJp:
王子と一緒にいる盗賊ってのは
どんな連中だろうな

MsgEn: Those guys are like noble thieves, or maybe just a group of bandits—
MsgJp:
義賊みたいなやつらかそれとも
ただの山賊集団か――

MsgEn:
The enemy is an "Evil Dragon", right?
This is not the time for a fight between a bandit and a royal vassal.
MsgJp:
敵は“悪しき竜”だろ？
盗賊と王家の家臣が揉めている場合じゃねえ
――って言ってこいよ

MsgEn:
I'll take care of the orcs and whatnot.
You take care of the prince.
MsgJp:
俺はオークだのなんだのを引き受けるから
王子は頼むぜ

MsgEn: I don't think it's the time to slack off, but well, that's something the generals decide.
MsgJp:
緩んでる場合じゃねえと思うけどよ
まあ、それは将軍たちが決めることだな

MsgEn: Since I became an Arisen, I've been fighting Orcs all this time and now I'm getting all sniffly.
MsgJp:
覚者になってからこっちずっとオークと
戦って鼻がバカになっちまったが

MsgEn: The scent of Acre Selund's Orcs is unique; it makes you feel refreshed and ready to fight.
MsgJp:
アッカーシェランのオークの匂いは
また独特――新鮮な気分で戦えるぜ

MsgEn: Ignoring the troublesome negotiations, Leave it to me if it comes down to a direct confrontation.
MsgJp:
面倒な駆け引きはともかく
真っ向ぶつかり合いなら俺に任せろ

MsgEn: The purpose of the "Evil Dragon" is to demonstrate their own power.
MsgJp:
“悪しき竜”の目的が自分の力を
誇示するためとは――

MsgEn: That's a kid's theory, isn't it?
MsgJp: そりゃガキ大将の理屈じゃねえか

MsgEn:
I'm seeing the number of orcs in Lookout Castle
And they're getting fewer, little by little.
MsgJp:
展望城のオークの数も見えてきたな
しかも少しずつだが、減っていやがる

MsgEn: Gillian and the others are doing a great job, you know.
MsgJp: ジリアンたち、いい仕事してるぜ

MsgEn:
I'm seeing the number of orcs in Lookout Castle
And they're getting fewer, little by little.
MsgJp:
展望城のオークの数も見えてきたな
しかも少しずつだが、減っていやがる

MsgEn: Gillian and the others are doing a great job, you know.
MsgJp: ジリアンたち、いい仕事してるぜ

MsgEn: My blood is boiling, man.
MsgJp: 血がよ、ザワザワと沸くようだぜ

MsgEn: I'm sure General Meirova will be blasting out one operation after another.
MsgJp:
メイロワ将軍のことだから次から次へと
作戦をぶち上げそうだな

MsgEn: Time for a rest.
MsgJp: 少し休ませろって話だ

MsgEn: Damn--no matter what I do, I'm always thinking about that pitch black bastard.
MsgJp:
チッ――何をしていても
真っ黒野郎のことを考えちまうぜ

MsgEn:
Damn--there's a lot of distractions.
I can't focus on the enemy in front of me if I keep going like this.
MsgJp:
くそ――あれこれ雑念が多いな
このままじゃ目の前の敵に
集中できねえぞ

MsgEn: How's your body feeling?
MsgJp: 身体の調子はどうだ？

MsgEn:
We can't be sure it won't affect us too.
We should do what we can while we can.
MsgJp:
俺らにも影響が出ないとは限らねえ
今のうちにやれることやっておかねえと

MsgEn: When you let your mind wander... your strength will wander, too. I'm going in strong.
MsgJp:
気い抜くと――力も抜けるんだ
気張って行くぜ

MsgEn: I'll do my best not to be a liability.
MsgJp:
足手まといにならねえように
せいぜい気ぃ張るぜ

MsgEn:
Please don't talk to me.
I'm a bundle of hatred right now.
MsgJp:
話しかけないでくれ
今の俺は憎悪の塊だぜ

MsgEn:
You should have bet on this, that, and the other thing.
You could have made a fortune.
MsgJp:
あれやこれや、賭けときゃ良かったぜ
大儲けできたろうによ

MsgEn:
If you like to be alone so much, leave him alone.
I don't know.
MsgJp:
そんなにひとりが良いなら
ひとりにしてやれよ――ってわけには
いかねえかぁ

MsgEn: This is a very frustrating situation, isn't it?
MsgJp:
これはなんとも歯がゆい状況だな
え？

MsgEn: Yeah, I'll listen if you want to talk.
MsgJp:
心配事は性に合わねえ
俺は戦闘のあるところへ行かせて
もらうぜ

MsgEn: Well, in this situation, there's nothing else to do but keep moving forward, with gusto. It's always the same thing.
MsgJp:
まあ、こうなったら深いこと考えずに
ガスガスと前に進むしかねえよな
毎度のことだ

MsgEn: I'm going to sleep ―― Oh, what the heck, I'll sleep for about ten days straight.
MsgJp:
寝るぞ――俺は――ああ、なんなら
十日くらいぶっ通しで眠ってやる

MsgEn: There is still much to research,
MsgJp: まだまだ、研究すべきことは多いな――

MsgEn: Strange occurrences are happening everywhere today. There must be a definite cause for it.
MsgJp:
各地では異変が今日も起こっている
その原因は必ずあるはずなのだ

MsgEn: The increase of enemies is definitely related to the decline of the White Dragon. What exactly is a dragon to the world—?
MsgJp:
魔物の増加は白竜の衰えと
確実に関係している
竜とは、いったい世界にとって何者のか――

MsgEn: What is it? I have no intention of talking to an Arisen and wasting time on idle chatter. Just tell me your business.
MsgJp:
なんだ
覚者と無駄話をする気は無い
用件を言ってくれ

MsgEn: The Order of the Knights values unity—So, what exactly do you think "the unity of the Order of the Knights" means?
MsgJp:
騎士団は団結を尊ぶ――
では、“騎士団の団結”とは具体的には何だと思う

MsgEn: I think "loyalty to Commander Gerd" is the equivalent. --If so, then I shouldn't be speaking to an Arisen.
MsgJp:
自分は“ゲルト団長への忠誠心”が
それにあたると思っている
――覚者にこんな話をすべきではないな

MsgEn: I said I didn't intend to chat. You don't think your feelings have slackened, do you?
MsgJp:
無駄話をするつもりは無いと言っただろう
気持ちがたるんでいるんじゃないか

MsgEn: No time for idle chatter, let's get to the point.
MsgJp: 無駄話はいい、さっそく本題に入るぞ

MsgEn: You are part of a party for another mission.
MsgJp:
――貴君は他のミッションの元に
パーティを組んでいるな

MsgEn: Please cancel your participation in the mission over there first, and then come here again.
MsgJp:
先にそちらのミッションの参加予定を
取り消し、あらためてここに来てくれ

MsgEn: Arisen, don't let your guard down.
MsgJp: 覚者、気を抜くなよ

MsgEn: Sorry, but I'm in the middle of a mission.
MsgJp: 悪いが今は任務の途中だ

MsgEn: We can't afford for the monsters to increase like this.
MsgJp: こう魔物が増えてはたまらない

MsgEn: When will this battle end?
MsgJp: いつこの戦いは終わるのだ

MsgEn: Enemy extermination is all there is, really.
MsgJp: 魔物退治ばかりだな、まったく

MsgEn: We can't rely too much on supplies from the temple.
MsgJp: 神殿からの補給もあまりあてにできないぞ

MsgEn: Please don't talk to me right now
MsgJp: 今は話しかけないでくれ

MsgEn: The White Dragon's blessing!
MsgJp: 白竜様のご加護を！

MsgEn: Let me concentrate on the mission.
MsgJp: 任務に集中させてくれ

MsgEn: -- Mmm-hmm. - Mmm-hmm.
MsgJp: ――くく、くくく――

MsgEn: Oh... What? Don't talk to me.
MsgJp: ひ――なんだ、話掛けるな

MsgEn: Ah, yes, let's do that―― That's good――
MsgJp:
ああ、そうだ、そうしよう――
それがいい――

MsgEn: What?
-- Uh-uh, not now.
MsgJp: ――うぅ、今はやめて

MsgEn: Go over there――
MsgJp: あっちへ、いっていて――

MsgEn: Hello, do you need anything?
MsgJp: やあ、何かご用かな？

MsgEn: Well, I've got to start thinking about my next stocking.
MsgJp:
さぁて、そろそろ次の仕入れ支度を
考えないと

MsgEn: Oh, do you want to see the goods? I'm sorry, there are many things that haven't been fully prepared yet.
MsgJp:
おっと、商品をみたいかい？
申し訳ない、今は準備しきれて
いないものも多くてね

MsgEn: Master Arisen, how are you feeling today?
MsgJp: 覚者さま、ご機嫌いかがですか

MsgEn: Ah, please wait a little ―― Yes, what is it?
MsgJp:
ああ、ちょっと待ってください
――はい、何か？

MsgEn: I sometimes think that it might be good for business if we could make some weapons.
MsgJp:
武器でも作れたら商売になるかもと
思うこともあるんですがね

MsgEn: Hey, how are you feeling?
MsgJp: やあ、調子はどうだい

MsgEn: Today's existence is also thanks to The White Dragon
MsgJp: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげだよ

MsgEn: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.
MsgJp: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな

MsgEn: How are you?
MsgJp: ご機嫌いかが？

MsgEn: Yes, life is becoming increasingly difficult.
MsgJp: 暮らしは厳しくなる一方だね

MsgEn: Please, do your best with your work.
MsgJp: お仕事、頑張ってくださいな

MsgEn: Oh, are you an Arisen? I'm grateful for your assistance in my research.
MsgJp:
おや、覚者さんかな
研究に付き合って貰って感謝しているよ

MsgEn: There are strange occurrences happening everywhere I am investigating them, you know. Traveling throughout Lestania.
MsgJp:
異変はそこかしこで起こっている
私はそれを探求していてね
レスタニア中を巡っている

MsgEn: Should I investigate this area a little further?
MsgJp: この辺りをもう少し調べていくか――

MsgEn: Hey, how are you doing?
MsgJp: やあ、調子はどうだい

MsgEn: Today's existence is also thanks to The White Dragon
MsgJp: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげだよ

MsgEn: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.
MsgJp: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな

MsgEn:
Ah, a wonderful meal!
Cooking is the ultimate harmony of all ingredients and the cook's hands!
MsgJp:
ああ、素晴らしきかな食事！
料理とはあらゆる素材と料理人の手が
織りなす究極のハーモニーなのだ！

MsgEn: If you know anything about rare ingredients, please tell me.
MsgJp:
珍しい食材について知っていたら
教えてくれたまえ

MsgEn: Hmm... I wonder if that monster's meat could be cooked.
MsgJp:
ふむ――意外とあの魔物の肉は
焼いたらいけるかもしれんな

MsgEn: Hehehe――How are you feeling today?
MsgJp: ヒヒヒヒ――ご機嫌いかが？

MsgEn: I am looking for it, you know. That thing, you know.
MsgJp:
わたしはね、あれを探しているのさ
アレをね――

MsgEn: What's up? Do you need something?
MsgJp: なんだい、何か用でもあるのかい？

MsgEn: Hey, how are you doing?
MsgJp: やあ、調子はどうだい

MsgEn: Today's existence is also thanks to The White Dragon
MsgJp: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげだよ

MsgEn: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.
MsgJp: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな

MsgEn: Hey, are you also exploring? Don't you find this area quite interesting?
MsgJp:
やあ、君も探索かね？
この辺りはなかなか興味深いと思わないか

MsgEn: I enjoy testing people— No, no, no, don't take this the wrong way.
MsgJp:
私は人を試すのが趣味でね――
いやいや、悪くとらないでくれたまえ

MsgEn:
I'm simply interested in people.
What some aspire to, what some think, what some accomplish.
MsgJp:
単に人に興味があるだけだよ
ある者が何を目指し、何を思い、何を成すかね

MsgEn: You seem to have confidence in your skills. Do you ever wonder about it?
MsgJp:
君は、なかなか腕に自信がありそうだ
――時に思うことはないかな？

MsgEn: How much are your abilities really worth?
MsgJp: 己の力量は、真にどれほどのものか――とね

MsgEn: Oh, do you need something from me?
MsgJp: おお、私に何か用かね？

MsgEn: Yes, can I help you?
MsgJp: はぁい、何か用？

MsgEn: I am traveling around different places, Well, for now, I guess you could say I'm a bit of a treasure hunter.
MsgJp:
わたしは各地を旅して回ってんの
まぁ、一応これでも
トレジャーハンターのはしくれよ

MsgEn: If you have information on a treasure, let's exchange it!
MsgJp: お宝情報があったら交換しましょ

MsgEn: There are still plenty of caves and ruins that I have never been to, you know.
MsgJp:
まだまだ行った事のない洞窟や遺跡は
たくさんあるのよね

MsgEn: Not a lot of potential prey out there.
MsgJp: 獲物になりそうなのは、あまりいないな

MsgEn: What? What are you aiming for?
MsgJp: なんだ？　お前は何狙いだ？

MsgEn: Troublesome enemies are best attacked from a distance.
MsgJp: 厄介な魔物は遠くから狙うに限る

MsgEn: Hmph, don't talk to me.
MsgJp: フン、話しかけるな

MsgEn: Go away
MsgJp: よそへ行け

MsgEn: There is nothing to say anymore.
MsgJp: 話すことなどない

MsgEn: Ah, what the hell.
MsgJp: あぁ、なんだてめぇ

MsgEn: Stop it, don't talk to me right now.
MsgJp: やめろよ、今は話しかけるんじゃねぇよ

MsgEn: Well, my wallet is light.
MsgJp: ちっ、懐が厳しいぜ

MsgEn: Ah――
MsgJp: アァ――

MsgEn: Ugh--
MsgJp: ウゥ――

MsgEn: Body...ga...aah.
MsgJp: カラダ――ガ――アァ――

MsgEn: -- Gigi.
MsgJp: ――ギギ

MsgEn: Uuu...
MsgJp: ウウウ――

MsgEn: How much longer will we...
MsgJp: 我々は、いつまで――

MsgEn: I want to go home--
MsgJp: 帰りたい――

MsgEn: Will Cecily be saved? There is no need to worry because you guys are taking action. I keep telling myself that, but...
MsgJp: どうして、こんな姿に――

MsgEn:
Hm-?
Oh, please don't attack me.
I don't have any intention to fight.
MsgJp:
ん――？
ああ、攻撃しないでくださいね
たたかう気はありませんので

MsgEn: Oh, do you find it unusual for a monster like me to speak?
MsgJp:
――あら
魔物のわたしが話すのが珍しいですか？

MsgEn:
I grew up near Jingen, so I know Harpies can sing, so they can have a voice.
I'm not sure if they can learn human language or not.
MsgJp:
ハーピーは歌が命ですから声は出せるのですが
人間の言葉を覚えるかどうかは、それぞれですね
わたしはジンゲンに近い所で育ちましたから

MsgEn: I'm getting hungry. I have to go hunting later.
MsgJp:
お腹――減ってきちゃった
あとで狩りにいかないと

MsgEn: Hey, how are you doing?
MsgJp: やあ、調子はどうだい

MsgEn: Today's existence is also thanks to The White Dragon
MsgJp: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげだよ

MsgEn: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.
MsgJp: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな

MsgEn: Hey, how are you doing?
MsgJp: やあ、調子はどうだい

MsgEn: Today's existence is also thanks to The White Dragon
MsgJp: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげだよ

MsgEn: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.
MsgJp: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな

MsgEn: Oh, how are you doing?
MsgJp: おお、調子はどうだ？

MsgEn: Today exists because of The White Dragon exists.
MsgJp: 今日があるのも、白竜様あってこそだ

MsgEn: I kindly ask for your assistance with the task.
MsgJp: 任務ではよろしく頼む

MsgEn: Don't let your guard down.
MsgJp: お互い気が抜けんな

MsgEn: Get pumped up!
MsgJp: 気合を入れろよ

MsgEn: The monsters keep increasing.
MsgJp: 魔物は増える一方だ

MsgEn: Hey, how are you doing?
MsgJp: やあ、そっちはどうだい

MsgEn: For the sake of the White Dragon.
MsgJp: 白竜さまのために、だな――

MsgEn: I can't stand it when these monsters increase like this.
MsgJp: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな

MsgEn: Well, be careful with your body.
MsgJp: まぁ、体には気をつけろよ

MsgEn: That's nice, don't let your guard down.
MsgJp: いいな、気は抜くなよ

MsgEn: Are you a pawn bearer? I'm envious.
MsgJp: お前はポーン持ちなのか？　羨ましいよ

MsgEn: Phew, it's hard to relax.
MsgJp: ふう、なかなか気が休まらないよ

MsgEn: It's a mission, after all.
MsgJp: 任務は任務だからな

MsgEn: I need to train more...
MsgJp: もっと鍛えないとな――

MsgEn: Hmm, how are you feeling?
MsgJp: ん、調子はどうだ？

MsgEn: Under the protection of The White Dragon!
MsgJp: 白竜さまの加護を！

MsgEn: Supplies replenishment and enemy extermination have no end in sight.
MsgJp: 物資補給も魔物討伐も終わりがみえんよ

MsgEn: How are you feeling?
MsgJp: ご機嫌いかがかしら？

MsgEn: Let's both be careful and not let our guard down.
MsgJp: お互い、油断せずいきましょう

MsgEn: Both the Arisen and the Knights face the same hardships, I believe.
MsgJp:
覚者も騎士も、苦労は同じだと
思うのよね

MsgEn: Yeah, how's it going?
MsgJp: あぁ、調子はどうだ？

MsgEn: The number of monsters is increasing.
MsgJp: 魔物どもは増える一方だな

MsgEn: Hmm, what can I do for you?
MsgJp: ん、何か用か？

MsgEn: - The inspection of the equipment should be done regularly.
MsgJp: ――装備の点検はこまめにな

MsgEn: Always be prepared.
MsgJp: 準備はいつも整えておけよ

MsgEn: Tools are necessary in case of emergencies.
MsgJp: 道具類はまさかの時に必要だぞ

MsgEn: Phew, both of us seem to be going through a tough time, don't we?
MsgJp: ふう、まったくお互い大変そうね

MsgEn: I'd rather run away than be eaten by demons.
MsgJp:
魔物に食われるくらいなら
逃げるよ、わたしは

MsgEn: So, what should we do next?
MsgJp: さぁ、次はどうしようか

MsgEn: How's it going?
MsgJp: 調子はどうだ？

MsgEn: Try to keep your equipment as light as possible. The difference in mobility is significant.
MsgJp:
装備はできるだけ軽くしておけよ
足の差はでかいぞ

MsgEn: When climbing on large monsters, observe their movements well.
MsgJp:
大型魔物に登るときは、奴らの動きを
よく観察しろよ

MsgEn: Yeah, what?
MsgJp: うん、何？

MsgEn: I'm sorry, please don't talk to me right now
MsgJp: ごめんね、今ちょっと話しかけないで

MsgEn: You don't have any special purpose, right?
MsgJp: 特に用はないんでしょ？

MsgEn: Oh, what is it?
MsgJp: ――ああ、なんだ？

MsgEn: What's wrong, do you want to ask something?
MsgJp: どうした、何か聞きたいのか？

MsgEn: You never know when the enemy will strike.
MsgJp: 敵はいつくるかわからんぞ

MsgEn: How are you feeling?
MsgJp: ご機嫌いかが？

MsgEn: What did you come here for?
MsgJp: ここには何しにきたの？

MsgEn: Well, it's time to go somewhere else.
MsgJp: さ、そろそろ別のところへいこうかな

MsgEn: Hmm, what is it?
MsgJp: ふむ――なにかね？

MsgEn: Lately, there have been quite a few troublesome incidents.
MsgJp: 近頃はなかなか厄介な事件が増えてきたな

MsgEn: If there is a way to suppress the enemy's activity, that would be great.
MsgJp: 魔物の活性を抑える術があればいいのだが

MsgEn: Oh, how are you feeling?
MsgJp: あら、ご機嫌いかがですか？

MsgEn: The demand for healers continues to increase.
MsgJp: 癒し手の需要は増える一方です

MsgEn: May you have a good guidance on your journey
MsgJp: あなたの旅によき導きがありますように

MsgEn: May you have a good guidance on your journey
MsgJp: あなたの旅によき導きがありますように

MsgEn: Today's existence is also thanks to The White Dragon
MsgJp: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげでございます

MsgEn: Thank you for your hard work, Arisen.
MsgJp: 任務、ご苦労様です覚者様

MsgEn: May you have a good guidance on your journey
MsgJp: あなたの旅によき導きがありますように

MsgEn: Today's existence is also thanks to The White Dragon, isn't it
MsgJp: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげですね

MsgEn: Good luck with your work, Arisen
MsgJp: お仕事頑張ってくださいませ、覚者さま

MsgEn: Okay, keep up the practice!
MsgJp: よし、その調子で修練を重ねろよ！

MsgEn: Skill does not come in a day! You have to learn each one step by step.
MsgJp:
技は一日にしてならず！
ひとつひとつ身に付けていくんだ

MsgEn: There's no such thing as too much training. Take your time and practice before the actual battle!
MsgJp:
訓練にやりすぎはないぞ
じっくり実戦前に稽古していけ！

MsgEn: Oh, do you have any questions about the training?
MsgJp: おう、訓練について質問か？

MsgEn: Master Arisen, chosen by the White Dragon - If it's about ancient weapons, I can be of assistance.
MsgJp:
白竜に選ばれし覚者様――
古の武器についてであれば、お力になれるかと

MsgEn: It's not only humans who choose weapons - Sometimes, weapons also choose their wielders.
MsgJp:
人が武器を選ぶばかりではなく――
時として、武器が人を選ぶこともありましょう

MsgEn: Please do not forget that
MsgJp: どうか貴方様も、それをお忘れなく

MsgEn: A weapon has as many forms as there are things to kill.
MsgJp:
武器とは、討つべきものの数だけ
それに相応しき“かたち”があるもの――

MsgEn: To repel the fearsome demons that can become enemies of the dragon, the blades we wield must also be special.
MsgJp:
竜の敵となりうるおそろしき魔を退けるには
手に持つ刃もまた、特別でなければなりません

MsgEn: From ancient times, the wisdom that has been passed down continues to flow— Of the Arisen, and the people known as Pawns—
MsgJp:
遠き古より流れ伝わる智――
覚者の、そしてポーンの民の――

MsgEn: Is it not necessary for a Myrmidion to seek better weapons and armor, to become their own Masters sword and shield?
MsgJp:
戦徒が、自ら主の剣となり鎧となるために
より良き剣や鎧を生まんとするは
必然ではないでしょうか――

MsgEn: Oh, how's the investigation going?
MsgJp: おう、調査の進捗はどうだ？

MsgEn: I walked around the area and the ecosystem of this island seems to be very different from Lestania.
MsgJp:
辺りをぐるっと歩いてみたが
この島の生態系はレスタニアとは
えらく違うようだな

MsgEn: You never know when and what kind of creatures will come at you. Always review your equipment and items so you can handle any situation that arises. It's the fundamentals of exploration and investigation!
MsgJp:
いつ、どんな魔物が飛び出してくるかわからんぞ
とっさの状況にも対処できるよう
装備や持ち物は常に見直しておけよ
調査探索の基本だ！

MsgEn: This Bloodbane Isle expedition team is comprised of elite members. Although it is a difficult mission, their morale is high. ――As for me? I'm also feeling a surge of courage after a long time!
MsgJp:
この魔赤島調査隊は精鋭揃いだ
難しい任務ではあるが、士気も高い
――俺か？　俺も久しぶりに勇み立ってるな！

MsgEn: I used to be involved in the defense of Fort Gritten, but since that Mogok guy went down, I haven't had the same level of excitement--the competition has really been lacking.
MsgJp:
前はグリッテン砦の防衛戦に参加していたんだが
モゴックの奴が墜ちてからは
いまいち張り合いが無くてな――

MsgEn: When I received the offer to become an Area Master here, I thought, "This is it!"
MsgJp:
ここのエリアマスター就任の打診を受けた時は
これぞ、と思ったものだ！

MsgEn: As you can see, this base is temporary but we have gathered the necessary equipment for the investigation.
MsgJp:
見ての通り、この駐屯地は臨時のものだ
だが、調査のために必要なものについては
それなりの質のものを集めている

MsgEn: Not only the quantity, but also the quality is meticulous! Please tell your subordinates to use it without hesitation.
MsgJp:
質だけじゃなく、数もきっちり揃えてあるぞ！
お前の部下たちにも遠慮なく使うよう
言っておいてくれ

MsgEn: Oh, you've arrived! Let me introduce myself again. I'm Bertrand, the captain of the Bloodbane Isle research team. I'm also the Area Master of this island.
MsgJp:
おう、来たな！
あらためて自己紹介しておこうか
魔赤島調査隊、隊長のベルトランだ
この島のエリアマスターも兼任している

MsgEn: Even though I say I'm an Area Master, the situation is like this. I still don't understand anything! First, I have to set up the base.
MsgJp:
エリアマスターとは言っても
こんな状況だ
まだ何一つわからんがな！
まずは拠点を一通り設営したところだ

MsgEn: Don't look so worried! I've brought a team of agile individuals as my direct reconnaissance unit to swiftly explore the entire island. So, rest assured!
MsgJp:
――そう不安そうな顔をするな！
島の全体像を早期に探るべく
身軽な人員を俺直属の斥候隊として
連れてきたから安心してくれ！

MsgEn:
We'll have them avoid combat as much as possible,
and focus on exploring the island's terrain and demonic inhabitants.
MsgJp:
彼らにはなるべく戦闘を避けさせ
島の地形や魔物の生息状況を
重点的に探らせていく予定だ

MsgEn: And so, my job involves overseeing information from various units, including the scout team, and supervising the direction of the investigation.
MsgJp:
そして、斥候隊を始めとする
各部隊からの情報を統括したり
調査の方向性を監督するのが俺の仕事ってわけだ

MsgEn: Speaking of the overseer, each of you can proceed with the investigation based on your own judgment! This is a direct order from Joseph himself.
MsgJp:
監督といっても
お前たちはそれぞれの判断で
調査を進めてくれて構わん！
ジョゼフ様直々のお達しだ

MsgEn: I don't intend to sit still at this base either! In this unknown situation, it's the perfect opportunity to test my abilities. I'm itching to go!
MsgJp:
俺もこの拠点で大人しくしているつもりは無いぞ！
この未知の状況、己の実力を計るには
絶好のチャンスだ！　腕が鳴るな！

MsgEn: How is the progress of the investigation? I have allocated support items, so it would be good to bring them along. I am expecting great work from you in the future!
MsgJp:
調査の進捗はどうだ？
支援品を割り当てておいたから
持っていくといい
今後の働きに期待してるぞ！

MsgEn: The results of the investigation are beginning to show, but the situation remains severe. Let's continue in this way.
MsgJp:
調査の成果が出始めているな
厳しい状況に変わりはないが
この調子で進めていこう

MsgEn:
Your squad always does a great job, too.
You can take a little extra support supplies with you!
I'm looking forward to seeing more of you in the future!
MsgJp:
お前の隊もいつも頑張ってくれている
支援品を少し大目に持っていくといい
今後も期待してるぞ！

MsgEn:
Hmmm, of all these survey teams, the one that stands out from the rest is yours!
That's what I'm talking about, Masters Joseph's endorsement!
MsgJp:
ふむ、この調査隊の中でも
ずば抜けた動きをしているのが
お前の隊だろう！
さすがはジョゼフ様のお墨付きだ！

MsgEn:
If you keep running around, you'll exhaust yourself even more. 
I'll increase the allocation of support items, so please don't hesitate to take them.
MsgJp:
走り回ればそれだけ消耗もしているだろう
支援品の割り当てを増やしておくから
遠慮せずに持っていってくれ

MsgEn: Regardless, being able to quickly discover a cave in such a good condition, that could serve as a base was truly fortunate!
MsgJp:
それにしても、拠点にできるような
状態の良い洞窟を早々に発見できたのは
本当に幸運だったな！

MsgEn: Do you know about the cave located in the southern part of the island? Within our expedition team, we refer to it as the "Cesspool of Filth".
MsgJp:
島の南の方にある洞窟を知っているか？
調査隊内では《不浄の掃き溜め》と
呼んでいる洞窟だ

MsgEn:
Actually, we also discovered that place around the same time as this cave.
But unlike here, the interior is in a terrible state.
MsgJp:
実はあそこも、この洞窟と同時期に
発見していたんだが
ここと違って、内部が凄まじい状態でな

MsgEn:
Some kind of predator was living in the area.
There was rotting dead meat scattered around--
and the smell was terrible!
MsgJp:
何らかの肉食獣が棲みついていたのか
そこら辺に腐った死肉が散乱して――
臭いもそれはひどいもんだった！

MsgEn:
I had a hunch there was a predator lurking in the back,
so I sealed it off early.
I'm sure you could explore it if you're up to it.
MsgJp:
奥に肉食獣が潜伏しているのを予感して
早期に封鎖しておいたんだが、
お前の実力があれば探索できそうだ

MsgEn: If it's in your nature to not mind the smell, go and explore the interior.
MsgJp:
もし臭いが気にならない性質なら
内部を探索しに行ってみてくれ

MsgEn: By the way, do you know that there is an open piece of land if you go west from here? The survey team calls it "Corrupted Ground Facing the Waterfall".
MsgJp:
そういえば、ここから西に行ったところに
開けた土地があるんだが知っているか？
調査隊では《滝を臨む蝕地》と呼んでいるが――

MsgEn: There have been corruptions, infected goblins wandering around over there for a while, but recently, their number has increased and they seem to have formed a large herd.
MsgJp:
あそこには以前から
侵食ゴブリンどもがうろついていたんだが
最近、数が増えて大きな群れになっているようだ

MsgEn: Even though they are goblins, they become even more aggressive due to the corrupting effect, and it can be troublesome when there are many of them. Be careful not to underestimate them and suffer the consequences.
MsgJp:
元がゴブリンとはいえ
侵食の作用で凶暴化している上に
数がいると中々厄介だぞ
侮って痛い目を見ないよう気を付けてくれ

MsgEn:
You came just in time!
I have a favor to ask you.
MsgJp:
ちょうどいいタイミングで来てくれた！
お前に頼みたいことがあってな

MsgEn: From this base, a place resembling an old underground cathedral was discovered along the southwestern coast. It had been sealed off, but was finally able to be opened the other day.
MsgJp:
この拠点から南西の方角の海岸沿いに
古い地下聖堂のような場所が見つかってな
封鎖されていたが、先日ようやく開けることができた

MsgEn:
Inside, water is flowing, creating a serene atmosphere—
We call it the "Crypt of Murmurs."
Well, it's unclear whether it was actually used as a sanctuary—
but it has a holy land-like ambiance.
MsgJp:
中は水が流れていて静かな雰囲気だ――
俺たちは《せせらぎの地下聖堂》と呼んでいる
まぁ、実際に聖堂として使われていたのかは
定かではないが――

MsgEn: Unusually for this island, there seems to be a great number of cultural structures that have been preserved. I believe there may be something to gain by exploring there.
MsgJp:
この島には珍しく、文化的な造形物が
数多く残されているようだ
あそこを探ることで、何か得るものが
あるんじゃないかと思ってな

MsgEn: However, within, there are highly dangerous enemies wandering around, and unless one possesses sufficient fighting power, I cannot entrust the investigation to them.
MsgJp:
だが、内部には危険度の高い
魔物が徘徊していて、
相応の戦力を持った者でないと
とても調査は任せられん

MsgEn: That's why I'm asking for your help. I'll leave it to you to decide when to head out to investigate. When you're ready, give me a call again!
MsgJp:
そこで、お前に頼みたいというわけだ
調査に向かうタイミングは任せよう
準備ができたら、また声をかけてくれ！

MsgEn:
Thanks to the efforts of each team member,
the investigation of this island is progressing!
Your team's work, in particular, is exceptional!
MsgJp:
各隊員の尽力によって
この島の調査も進みつつあるな！
中でもお前の隊の働きは格別だ！

MsgEn: In this situation, it may not be possible to retaliate right away, but let's at least make arrangements to increase the allocation of aid supplies!
MsgJp:
この状況では中々報いてやることもできないが
せめて支援品の割り当てだけでも
増やせるように手配しておこう！

MsgEn: There should be one tower on this island, it's called the "Sage Tower Ruins". There is an old well near there.
MsgJp:
この島に一つ、塔があるだろう
《聖遺の塔》と呼ばれているあそこだ
あの近くに古い井戸があってな

MsgEn: The part of the well cover was rusted and couldn't be opened, but recently, I was finally able to pry it open.
MsgJp:
井戸蓋の部分が錆び付いていて
開けられなかったんだが
この間、ようやくこじ開けることができた

MsgEn: I haven't gotten around to exploring inside, but if you're available, it wouldn't hurt to take a peek.
MsgJp:
中の探索までは中々手が回っていないが
もしお前の手が空いていたら
覗いてみても損は無いだろう

MsgEn:
Did you know that there is an open area of land on the northern coast where carnivorous creatures tend to congregate?
It's a square where the carcasses of their prey are stored.
MsgJp:
北の方の沿岸に、肉食の魔物が集まりやすい
開けた土地があるのを知っているか？
獲物の死肉が溜め込まれている広場だ

MsgEn:
The other day, a new nightmare landed in that plaza.
I sent a squad to take it down, but they were flying around, singing and screaming and it was too much for them to handle.
MsgJp:
先日、あの広場に
新手のナイトメアが舞い降りたんだが
隊士を討伐に向かわせてみても、飛び回る上に
歌ったり叫んだりで手に負えんらしい

MsgEn: The voice of the Nightmare contains a special kind of magic, so be cautious when getting close to that area.
MsgJp:
ナイトメアの声には
特殊な魔力が込められているからな
あの辺りに近づく時は注意してくれ

MsgEn: That's right, I should tell you too. When I first came to this island, I was assigned to investigate the depths of the "Infected Den". Do you remember that there was a further expanse beyond it?
MsgJp:
そうだ、お前にも話しておこう
この島に来て最初に調査することになった
《侵食魔の巣窟》の奥に
更なる空間が広がっていたのを覚えているか？

MsgEn: The Corruption had progressed more than anticipated, so I temporarily sealed it off based on my judgment. However, considering that the investigation of the entire island has also progressed, I think it's about time to lift the blockade.
MsgJp:
予想以上に侵食が進んでいたことから
一旦は俺の判断で封鎖していたんだが
島全体の調査も進んできたことを考えて
そろそろ封鎖を解こうと思ってな

MsgEn: The depths have been corrupted, and there is no doubt that a powerful infected demon is nesting there.
MsgJp:
奥は侵食が進み
特に強力な侵食魔が巣食っていることは
まず間違いないだろう

MsgEn: When entering the investigation, please be extremely cautious and do not neglect your vigilance. Please also bring ample supplies of Anti-Corruption Medicine with you.
MsgJp:
調査に入る時は
くれぐれも警戒を怠らないように
抗侵薬の予備も豊富に用意して向かってくれ

MsgEn: The situation is becoming a bit troublesome. The speed of Corruption seems to be surpassing our expectations.
MsgJp:
ちょっとばかりマズい状況になってきてな
“侵食”の進行スピードがこちらの予想を
上回っているようだ――

MsgEn: An "Infected Goreclops" has appeared in the Wing Wind Plateau, and this individual's infection has advanced quite dramatically.
MsgJp:
《翼風高原》に
侵食ゴアサイクロプスが現れたんだが
こいつがまた派手に侵食が進んだ個体だ

MsgEn: It's called the "Corruption Core," it's got two thorny appendages sticking out of it. It's like the poison in the body has run out of places to go and started to burst out.
MsgJp:
“侵食核”って呼び名らしいが、とにかく頭に
イバラみたいなものを２本も生やしてやがる
あれは体に回りきった毒が
行き場を失って噴きだしたような状態だ

MsgEn: As I explained before, when a monster's corruption advances, its aggressiveness increases. However, when the corruption has progressed to that extent, it might be better to consider it as a different species of creature altogether.
MsgJp:
侵食が進んだ魔物は凶暴性が増すのは
前に説明した通りだが
あそこまで侵食が進んでしまうと
もう別種の魔物と考えた方がいいだろうな――

MsgEn: Anyway, leaving it to ordinary squad members isn't an option, but at the same time, I'm concerned that it might hinder the investigation.
MsgJp:
ともかく、あれは並の隊士に任せるわけにはいかない
かと言って、調査の妨げになる恐れから
放置するのも気がかりだ

MsgEn: If it's possible to rely on you, I would like to entrust the subjugation to you... If you are willing to accept, let me explain the details again.
MsgJp:
頼めるのであれば、お前に討伐を
任せたいんだが――
引き受けてくれるのであれば
あらためて詳細を説明しよう

MsgEn:
The remarkable work of your squad is absolutely mind-blowing!
You are indeed the expected successor to Leo!
MsgJp:
お前の隊の目覚ましい働きには
まったく舌を巻くばかりだ！
さすがはレオの後任と期待されるだけあるな！

MsgEn: I actually want to reward you more properly, but there are limitations to what can be obtained on this island. Among those, I will arrange for something particularly good to be allocated to your squad.
MsgJp:
本当はもっときちんと報いてやりたいものだが
この島では手に入るものに限りがあるからな――
その中でも一際良い物が
お前の隊に回るよう手配しよう

MsgEn: Keep up the good work and keep up the research. I'm counting on you!
MsgJp:
これからもその調子で調査を進めてくれ
頼りにしているぞ！

MsgEn: There is a large mine site across the bridge. Do you already know about it?
MsgJp:
橋を渡ったところに大きな坑道跡があるのは
もう知っているか？

MsgEn: Because there is fear of collapse in the old tunnels, We have been sealing them off for safety measures. However, since the ground doesn't seem to be too weak, We have decided to lift the seal.
MsgJp:
古い坑道は崩落が怖いからな
安全確保のために今まで封鎖していたが
地盤もそう脆くはないようだから
封鎖を解くことにした

MsgEn: Let me tell you in advance; If you want to explore uncharted territory, now is a great opportunity!
MsgJp:
お前には一足先に教えておこう
前人未踏の場所を探索してみたければ
今が絶好の機会だぞ！

MsgEn: There is a cave with a lot of water to the west. It is likely that it is the source of water in this area.
MsgJp:
西の方に水量の多い洞窟があってな
恐らくあそこが辺り一帯の
水源になってるんだろう

MsgEn: Once inside, you can hear the sound of the waterfall from all directions and almost lose your sense of direction. The survey team calls it "Waterfall Echo Cavern."
MsgJp:
中に入ると四方八方から滝の音が聞こえて
方向感覚を失いそうになるくらいだ
調査隊では《滝鳴洞穴》と呼んでいる

MsgEn: I get the impression that water is plentiful on this island as a whole, but Waterfall Echo Cavern is something else!
MsgJp:
この島は全体的に水が豊富な印象だが
《滝鳴洞穴》は別格だぞ

MsgEn: We had it sealed off due to the danger of being swept away in the dark cave and the presence of waterfalls, but you don't need to worry about that.
MsgJp:
暗い洞窟内で流される危険性や
滝の存在を考慮して封鎖していたが、
お前にはそんな心配は要らんな

MsgEn: Let's lift the blockade; Please go and see for yourself.
MsgJp:
封鎖を解いておこう
一度行ってみてくれ

MsgEn: Hmm... Don't you think that the rate of corruption has been increasing recently?
MsgJp:
ふむ――
最近は侵食のペースが以前にも増して
早まっているように思わないか？

MsgEn: Recently, we finished the initial investigation of a cave known as the "Fungal Colony Caves," but the interior is heavily corrupted. The place is filled with fungal spores.
MsgJp:
この間、《菌糸の襲窟》と呼んでいる洞窟の
初期調査が終わったんだが
内部もかなり侵食が進んでいて
そこらへん菌胞だらけになってやがってな

MsgEn: Even the troopers who went scouting took Anti-Corruption Medicine before they went.
MsgJp:
斥候に行った隊士も
あらかじめ抗侵薬を飲んでから向かったそうだ

MsgEn: In reality, it might not be as bad as it seems, but I can understand the concern about it.
MsgJp:
実際はそこまでするほどではないんだが
気持ちはわからんでもない有様だ――

MsgEn: Of course, the infected creatures are also crawling about. When you head towards the Fungal Colony Caves, make sure to bring the Anti-Corruption Medicine with you.
MsgJp:
当然、侵食魔もウヨウヨしている
お前も《菌糸の襲窟》に向かう時は
抗侵薬を忘れずに持っていくようにな

MsgEn: Hmm... Well, it seems that things have become somewhat troubling.
MsgJp:
ううむ――
いや、少しばかり悩ましい事態になってな

MsgEn: We discovered that a Corrupted Behemoth lurks in the depths of the "Fungal Colony Caves", and it's a troublesome one. Three squad members have already returned injured because of it.
MsgJp:
《菌糸の襲窟》の奥に、侵食ベヘモットが
潜んでいることがわかったんだが
こいつが厄介で――
すでに３人の隊士が負傷して帰ったほどだ

MsgEn: Normally, I would have headed there myself, but our stock of medical supplies is running out, and securing supplies has become a matter of the utmost urgency.
MsgJp:
本来であれば俺が向かいたいところだが
ストックしてある医療物資が
底を尽きかけていることもあって、
物資の確保が何よりの急務になってしまった

MsgEn: Sending squad members to face this threat without securing medical supplies, let alone heading out to face it alone, will definitely earn me a scolding from Clarissa.
MsgJp:
医療物資の確保も無しに
隊士を討伐に送り出したり、
まして一人討伐に飛び出したとなっては
間違いなくクラリッサに文句を言われるからな――

MsgEn: Yeah. Can you, without letting Clarissa know, go and defeat that Corrupted Behemoth for us?
MsgJp:
そうだ
お前、クラリッサに内緒で
あの侵食ベヘモットを
討伐してきてくれないか？

MsgEn: You've faced numerous large Corrupted Beasts in the past, and I believe you can defeat it! Opportunities to challenge such a formidable foe are rare. So, what do you say? If you're interested, let me know, and we can discuss it further.
MsgJp:
今までも大型の侵食魔を何体も
相手にしてきたお前なら、きっと倒せるはずだ！
こんな大物とやり合う機会もそう無いぞ！
どうだ？　気になったらあらためて声をかけてくれ

MsgEn: I have good news! With the progress of the investigation, the maintenance of the route for transporting supplies from Lestania is coming along quite well!
MsgJp:
良いニュースがあるぞ！
調査が進んだことで
レスタニアからの物資を運ぶルートの整備も
ずいぶんと捗ってな！

MsgEn:
They're going to be sending a steady stream of better relief supplies from now on.
This should make things a little easier on your squad.
MsgJp:
今後はより良い支援物資が安定して
送られてくるそうだ
これで、お前の隊も少しは楽になるだろう

MsgEn: Still, without you, we wouldn't have made this much progress in our survey of the island by now!
MsgJp:
それにしても、お前がいなければ
今頃この島の調査もここまでは進んで
いなかっただろう！

MsgEn: The passion and skills dedicated to the investigation of Bloodbane Isle are exceptional! We are expecting great things in the future!
MsgJp:
魔赤島調査にかける熱意、そして実力――
どれをとっても抜きんでた働きだ！
今後も期待しているぞ！

MsgEn: You've come to see me. Well, let's hear what you have to say.
MsgJp:
俺のところに来るとはな――
話を聞こうじゃないか

MsgEn: It is difficult to know that one is ignorant. Thinking "I know my own ignorance" might be evidence that it is not so.
MsgJp:
自分が無知であることを知るのは難しいことだ
「己の無知を知っている」と思うこと自体が
そうでないことの証明かも知れないだろう

MsgEn: There is more than one world. What do you think when you hear this?
MsgJp:
世界は一つではない――
こう聞いた時、お前は何を思う？

MsgEn: Do you think that there might be countries you don't know? Or do you think about the difficulty of mutual understanding among people? Or do you believe in the existence of something that you can't see?
MsgJp:
自分の知らない国があるかも知れないと思うか？
それとも人々の相互理解の難しさを考えるか？
あるいは自分には見えない何かの存在を信じるか？

MsgEn: Then don't hesitate, come here anytime.
MsgJp:
お前の見ている世界と
俺の見ている世界は違うかもしれないぜ

MsgEn: Since the person looking at it is different, it could be said that the world itself that is reflected in the eyes is different.
MsgJp:
それを見ている人間が違うんだから
目に映る世界自体が違うと言えなくもないだろう

MsgEn: You will come to know more things.
MsgJp:
お前はもっとたくさんのことを
知るようになるだろう――

MsgEn: It's not about gaining knowledge, Your eyes will see many worlds— Yes, as long as you pursue something.
MsgJp:
知識が増える、といったことじゃない
お前の目はたくさんの世界を見ることになる――
そう、何かを追い求める限りな

MsgEn: Your body is one, and no amount of bravery will change that.
MsgJp:
お前の身体はひとつだ――
いかな勇者とてそれは変わらない

MsgEn: First, we should focus on the trials we need to take on. No need to panic.
MsgJp:
まずは、挑むべき試練に集中するべきだ
慌てる事はない

MsgEn: Well met, Arisen of Lestania.
MsgJp: これはこれは、レスタニアの覚者様

MsgEn: How does Phindym appear to the people of Lestania?
MsgJp:
レスタニアの方の目には
フィンダムはどのように映るのですか？

MsgEn: I like Phindym. No, I have never been to another country—
MsgJp:
私はフィンダムが気に入っていますよ
いえ、他の地に赴いたことはありませんが――

MsgEn: Not only leaving this place, but I didn't even know that there were other places besides Phindym. It is the only place for me.
MsgJp:
ここを離れることはおろか
フィンダム以外の地があることすら知りませんでした
私にとっての唯一の場所なのです

MsgEn: Are you concerned about the stares? After all, we are seeing the people of Lestania for the first time.
MsgJp:
視線が気になりますか？
何せ我々はレスタニアの人々を初めて見るもので――

MsgEn: Hmm? Do you need something?
MsgJp: ん？　何か用かな？

MsgEn: Lestania— It has a mysterious sound, It feels fresh.
MsgJp:
レスタニア――
不思議な響きだな
新鮮な感じがするよ

MsgEn: I love traveling, you know. Even though my parents didn't approve of it, I traveled to various places for a while, leaving Dana behind.
MsgJp:
僕は旅好きでね
親には良い顔をされなかったけど
しばらくダナを離れて色んなところを回ったんだ

MsgEn: I would like to visit Lestania someday. It excites me just thinking about unknown places.
MsgJp:
いつかレスタニアにも行ってみたいものだな
自分の知らない場所があると思うと
それだけでワクワクしてくるよ

MsgEn: One day, when you have a moment, please take your time to tell me about Lestania.
MsgJp:
いつか、レスタニアの話を
ゆっくり聞かせてくれ
君らの手が空いた時でいい

MsgEn: Ah, Lestania's Lord Arisen!
MsgJp: あっ、レスタニアの覚者さん！

MsgEn: I used to have a bird, but I couldn't bring it with me... I wonder if it's doing well...
MsgJp:
ボク、鳥を飼ってたんだ
でも連れてこられなくて――
元気にしてるかなぁ――

MsgEn: Both me and my grandmother were living in a different village. We couldn't live there anymore, because of the corruption. That's why we came here to escape.
MsgJp:
ボクもおばあちゃんも、別の村に住んでたんだ
侵食のせいで住めなくなっちゃって――
それでここに逃げてきたんだよ

MsgEn: They say grandma will come home someday. I wonder if that's true—
MsgJp:
おばあちゃんはいつか帰れるっていうけど
ホントかな――

MsgEn: Is it unusual to have horns? You can touch if you want.
MsgJp:
角が珍しい？
触ってもいいよ

MsgEn:
ーーDon't people from Lestania have horns?
Don't they feel strange without them?
Do they feel empty or something?
MsgJp:
――レスタニアの人って
角が無くて困らないの？
何かスカスカした感じ、しない？

MsgEn: Lately, there have been nothing but strange things happening - I wonder what will happen from now on.
MsgJp:
最近は変なことばかり――
これから一体どうなるんだろうね――

MsgEn:
Hideous monsters appear,
Arisen ones from another world come--
What on is happening?
MsgJp:
おぞましい魔物が現れたり、
異世界の覚者が来たり――
一体どうなっているのやら

MsgEn: No, I don't intend to speak ill of you all. I'm just worried, that's all...
MsgJp:
いえ、あなた方を悪く言うつもりはなくてね
ただ、心配なだけで――

MsgEn: I, you know, I want to protect my family. I'll do anything to protect my grandchildren. I'll run away with my grandchildren anywhere.
MsgJp:
私はね、私の家族を守りたいんだよ
孫を守るためならなんだってするし
孫を連れてどこまでも逃げるよ

MsgEn: I may be anxious, but above all, my grandchildren are important— Everyone has something like that, don't they?
MsgJp:
心配性かも知れないけど、
何よりも孫が大切なんだ――
誰にだってそういうもの、あるだろ？

MsgEn: The feeling of wanting to protect something important is something that everyone has. If we were to lose it, we wouldn't know what would become of ourselves. That's how precious it is -
MsgJp:
大切なものを守りたいっていう気持ちは
誰にだってあるものさ
失ってしまったら自分がどうなるかわからない
そんな大切なものが――

MsgEn: Oh, you're the one from Lestania. Want to cross the river?
MsgJp:
あら、レスタニアの方
河を渡りたいのかしら？

MsgEn: Have you met Toreasa already? She's a bit shy, but she's actually a very nice person. She's diligent, gentle, and dedicated to her work.
MsgJp:
トレアサにはもうお会いになった？
彼女、少し人見知りなんだけど
本当はとっても良い人なのよ
真面目で、温厚で、仕事熱心で――

MsgEn: Here; Elan Water Grove is a beautiful place, right? The air is also clean――
MsgJp:
ここ、エラン水林は
綺麗なところでしょう？
空気も清浄で――

MsgEn: Is it because there is a lot of water after all? Well, try taking a deep breath on the boat. It will surely feel good.
MsgJp:
やっぱり水が多いからなのかしら？
ね、船の上で深呼吸してみて
きっと気持ちがいいわ

MsgEn: Ugh, I'm starting to get hungry... It's quite a physically demanding job, you know.
MsgJp:
はぁ、何だかお腹減ってきちゃった――
結構力仕事なのよねぇ

MsgEn: Do you need something?
MsgJp: 何か御用？

MsgEn: Sister Musel tends to be a bit—absorbed in her thoughts and research, so I try to help where I can.
MsgJp:
ミューセルお姉様は、その、ちょっと――
考え事や調べ物に熱中されがちだから
わたしができることはお手伝いしてるの

MsgEn: Please don't bother Suster Muselle too much
MsgJp:
あまりミューセルお姉様の手を
煩わせることはしないでね

MsgEn: Am I Sister Musel's disciple?  No, that's not it.  ――I wish I could be though.
MsgJp:
わたしがミューセルお姉様の弟子なのかって？
違うわ
――そうなれたらいいんだけど

MsgEn: It's a small place, but there is a sleeping space for travelers as well. I will take <VAL PRICE_INN> as payment, is that okay with you?
MsgJp:
狭いところだけど、旅人さん用の寝床もあるの
お代として<VAL PRICE_INN>もらうけど
いいかしら？

MsgEn: Yes
MsgJp: はい

MsgEn: No
MsgJp: いいえ

MsgEn:
We also have a sleeping area for travelers and we set it up properly every day.
Are you staying the night?
MsgJp:
旅人さん用の寝床も
毎日ちゃんと整えてるのよ
泊まっていくの？

MsgEn: Yes
MsgJp: はい

MsgEn: No
MsgJp: いいえ

MsgEn: "Treat Weakness," right? I learned it from Miss Musel, so I should be able to do it properly! It'll cost you <VAL PRICE_WEAK>. What do you say?
MsgJp:
《弱化の治療》、ね！
ミューセルお姉様に教えてもらったから
ちゃんとできるはず――！
お代は<VAL PRICE_WEAK>よ、どうする？

MsgEn: Yes
MsgJp: はい

MsgEn: No
MsgJp: いいえ

MsgEn: Huh? It seems you're not weakened, but if you're not feeling well, maybe taking a little rest would be a good idea.
MsgJp:
うーん？
弱化してないみたいだけど――
気分が優れないなら
少し休んでいくのはどうかしら

MsgEn: Is it the Arisen of Lestania? Is there something wrong?
MsgJp:
レスタニアの覚者か
どうかしたか？

MsgEn: Are there many Arisen in Lestania? - The dragon of Lestania couldn't choose just one Arisen?
MsgJp:
レスタニアには覚者がたくさんいるって？
――レスタニアの竜は、覚者を一人に
選びきれなかったのか？

MsgEn: I may not be an Arisen, but I've never neglected my training to protect the Spirit Dragon and Phindym.
MsgJp:
俺は覚者ではないが、
精霊竜とフィンダムを守るための
鍛練は欠かしたことがない

MsgEn: Arisen are the ones chosen by the dragons, But even if you're not chosen, the feeling of respecting the dragons does not change, you know.
MsgJp:
覚者こそは竜に選ばれし者だが、
選ばれなくたって竜を敬う気持ちに
変わりはないからな

MsgEn: What is it? I'm unusual? You're much rarer here than I am, but...
MsgJp:
何だ？　俺が珍しいのか？
ここではお前たちの方がよっぽど珍しいが――

MsgEn: Yo!　What can I do for you?
MsgJp: よぉ！　何か用かね？

MsgEn: How's the food in Phindym? I hope it suits your taste.
MsgJp:
フィンダムの飯はどうだ？
口に合うといいんだがな

MsgEn: I'm hungry――
MsgJp: 腹減ったな――

MsgEn: There is a place called Dana Village. The vegetables that grow around there have a rich and delicious taste! It's kind of like a strong and powerful flavor.
MsgJp:
ダナ村ってところがあってな、
そこらへんで採れる野菜は味が濃くてウマイ！
なんというか、力強い味だ

MsgEn: Only if you eat a full meal will these muscles be willing to work!
MsgJp:
腹いっぱい食ってこそ、
この筋肉も仕事する気になってくれるってもんよ

MsgEn: Lord Arisen of Lestania—
MsgJp: レスタニアの覚者か――

MsgEn: Do you have any business? If you want to play, I won't go easy.
MsgJp:
何か用か？
手合せしたいというなら、手加減はしない

MsgEn: Did you see that grotesque, tumor-like thing? It looks like a parasitic plant, resembling an enemy?
MsgJp:
魔物にできた腫れ物のような、
寄生植物のような――
あの気持ちが悪いものを見たか？

MsgEn: Apparently, you lose your mind when you get like that. I'd watch out for that.
MsgJp:
どうやら、ああなると正気を失ってしまうようだ
気を付けたいものだな

MsgEn: That thing that deforms demons—Actually, I heard that we can develop it too. I don't want to look that miserable—
MsgJp:
魔物を異形化させるアレ――
実は、我々もアレを発症する可能性があるらしい
あんな惨い姿にはなりたくないな――

MsgEn: Oh, you're from Lestania, aren't you?
MsgJp: あら、レスタニアの方ね？

MsgEn: Actually, I have tried to see if the swelling, like a tumor caused by corruption, can be healed by the prayers of a Priest. No luck there though.
MsgJp:
実は、侵食魔のあの腫れ物のようなアレ――
プリーストの祈りによって治らないか
試してみたことがあるのよ

MsgEn: Well, it just didn't heal.
MsgJp: まぁ、治らなかったわね

MsgEn: White Dragon, please get well!
MsgJp:
侵食魔にばかり目をとられがちだけど
植物や土の状態もひどいものよ

MsgEn: Those "spores" of the corrupting demon are erupting— It's better not to inhale them too much.
MsgJp:
侵食魔が噴き出しているあの“胞子”――
あまり吸い込まないようにした方がいいわ

MsgEn: You're an Arisen of Lestania. Do you want to board the ship?
MsgJp:
――レスタニアの覚者ですね
船に乗りたいのですか？

MsgEn: Moles are a little different, aren't they? It seems like they don't listen to people's stories much and they're always hungry for some reason—
MsgJp:
モルは少し変わったところがあるでしょう？
人の話をあまり聞いていないように見えたり
なぜかいつもお腹を空かせていたり――

MsgEn: They're a good kid, though. They're quite reliable with that.
MsgJp:
良い子なんですけどね
あれで中々しっかりしているんですよ

MsgEn: — What is it? Staring too much won't do any good.
MsgJp:
――なんですか
あまりジロジロ見ても
いいことはないですよ

MsgEn: Because it's by the river, this area will be cool, won't it? It's perfect for cooling off.
MsgJp:
川のそばだから、この辺りはひんやりするでしょう
涼むにはぴったりなんです

MsgEn: Ah, Lord Arisen! Do you have any business with me?
MsgJp:
あっ、覚者さま！？
自分にご用でしょうか？

MsgEn: The sun is shining today—What am I saying, I'm not...
MsgJp:
本日はお日柄もよく――
って、何を言っているんだ、俺は

MsgEn: No, no, no! I was a little nervous!
MsgJp:
い、いえいえ！
ちょっと緊張してしまいまして！

MsgEn: I'm sorry, I don't know what to tell you--
MsgJp: すみません、何をお話すれば良いのやら――

MsgEn: Hm? Oh, it's the Arisen.
MsgJp: ん？　ああ、覚者さまじゃないですか

MsgEn: Thank you for lending your strength to Acre Selund.
MsgJp:
アッカーシェランに力を貸してくださり
ありがとうございます

MsgEn: Just when there's peace down the road. Someday, please tell us about Lestania.
MsgJp:
この先平和になったらでいいんです
いつか、レスタニアのことを教えてください

MsgEn: I wonder if it's time to start moving soon.
MsgJp: ――そろそろ動く頃でしょうか

MsgEn: Hey, how are you doing?
MsgJp: やあ、元気かい？

MsgEn: I don't like to do anything too formal. I don't know why I was called for this assignment.
MsgJp:
堅苦しいことは嫌いでね
なんでこの任務に呼ばれたんだろう

MsgEn: I'd like to take a break soon.
MsgJp: そろそろ一息つきたいもんだ

MsgEn: When you're tired, Master Arisen; Take a little break.
MsgJp:
覚者さんも疲れたら
ちょっと休みなよ

MsgEn: Hey, what's up?
MsgJp: よう、どうした？

MsgEn: Talk to the bandit yourself. Is there anything wrong with you?
MsgJp:
自分から盗賊に話しかけて
アンタにマズいことは無いのか？

MsgEn: Master Arisen is surprisingly unpretentious
MsgJp:
覚者サマってのは
意外と気取らないもんなんだな

MsgEn:
This is indeed the situation.
If we lose Acre Selund, we're in trouble.
MsgJp:
さすがにこの状況だ
アッカーシェランが無くなっちゃ
困るからな

MsgEn: I don't mean to be rude, but...
MsgJp: 悪くいいたくはないが――

MsgEn: In the end, the prince was raised as a spoiled brat-- I suppose that's how it goes.
MsgJp:
王子は結局のところ
甘やかされて育ったお坊ちゃま――
そんなところかね

MsgEn: Many have pursued its whereabouts, but the Ring of Samara has chosen you.
MsgJp:
今まで多くの者たちがその行方を追っていたが
――サマラの指輪はおまえを選んだ

MsgEn: The fact that we are cooperating with you may also be the result of some higher power at work.
MsgJp:
俺たちがおまえに協力することになったのも
何かの力が働いてのことかもしれんな

MsgEn: Ah, something happened?
MsgJp: ああ、何かあったのか？

MsgEn: Thieves are everywhere.
MsgJp: 盗賊ってのはどこにでもいるからな

MsgEn: I was--I didn't really care about anything else. I was just as likely to plow a field to survive as I was to steal from it.
MsgJp:
俺はさ――別に何でもよかったんだよな
生きるために畑耕すのも
盗みに入るのもおんなじだったんだ

MsgEn: If you don't like being an Arisen and have nowhere else to go, come join the bandits.
MsgJp:
アンタも覚者が嫌ンなって
行き場が無くなったら盗賊団に来なよ

MsgEn: Hmph――
MsgJp: ふん――

MsgEn: Don't talk to me so casually. We are bandits, different from you all.
MsgJp:
あまり気安く話しかけるな
俺たちは盗賊だ、あんたらとは違う

MsgEn: I wonder how things ended up like this.
MsgJp: どうしてこんなことになったんだかな

MsgEn: I'm not in the mood to chat happily.
MsgJp: ――楽しくお喋りしてやる気はない

MsgEn:
Huh?
Oh, me? Are you talking to me?
MsgJp:
うん？
あ、俺？　俺に話しかけてんのか？

MsgEn: There is nothing in particular that I can do -
MsgJp:
話してやれることなんか
特に無いんだよな――

MsgEn: Stop it. Repeatedly talking to me with expectations...
MsgJp:
やめろ、何かを期待して
何度も話しかけるのは

MsgEn:
I'm not--
my chieftain told me not to get too friendly with strangers.
MsgJp:
む――
頭領に、よそものと
あんまり馴れ合うなって言われてるからよ

MsgEn:
No... Please spare me.
I lack a sense of humor, you know.
I wish I could have made you laugh.
MsgJp:
いやぁ――勘弁してくれ
俺、ユーモアってやつが無くてよ
あんたを笑かしてやれたらよかったんだがなぁ

MsgEn: Oh, come on in! Please have something to eat!
MsgJp:
あっ、いらっしゃい！
何か食べていってよ！

MsgEn: For the sake of everyone, we need to do something about the food situation ――
MsgJp:
みんなのために食料――
なんとかしないと――

MsgEn: I'm kind of hungry.
MsgJp: なんだかおなか空いてきちゃった

MsgEn: Ah-- But it's dangerous to just pick up and eat with such alacrity~!
MsgJp:
あ――
でも勢いだけの拾い食いは危険だからね～

MsgEn: There's rubble everywhere and it's dusty. I'd like to change the air if I could, but--
MsgJp:
瓦礫だらけでホコリっぽいし
できたら空気、入れ替えたいけど――

MsgEn: When I think about it, this room—doesn't have a window, does it?
MsgJp:
よく考えたらこの部屋――
窓ないよね？

MsgEn: Here, as I gaze at the fire alone, Various memories come rushing back...
MsgJp:
ここで一人火を眺めてると
色々と思い出しちゃうな――

MsgEn: You know... fire is amazing, isn't it?
MsgJp:
なんかさ――
火ってすごいよね

MsgEn: They can cook you a delicious meal, or they can-- take away everything that's important to you.
MsgJp:
おいしいごはん作ってくれることもあれば――
大事なもの何もかも奪ってくことだってあるし

MsgEn: Hahaha!
MsgJp: ははは！

MsgEn: Hey!
MsgJp: ちょっと！

MsgEn: Eh!?
MsgJp: えぇ！？

MsgEn: Hmm...
MsgJp: うーん

MsgEn: Hmm...
MsgJp: うーん

MsgEn: No, it's really impossible now.
MsgJp: ダメ、もうホントに無理

MsgEn: Alright!
MsgJp: よし！

MsgEn: Hey!
MsgJp: ねぇ！

MsgEn: Hey!
MsgJp: ねぇ！

MsgEn: Yes
MsgJp: ハァイ

MsgEn: I see...
MsgJp: そっか――

MsgEn: Is there anything?
MsgJp: 何か無いかなぁ？

MsgEn: If it becomes like this—!
MsgJp: こうなったら――！

MsgEn: This looks edible!
MsgJp: これは食べられそうだね！

MsgEn: Phew
MsgJp: ふぅー

MsgEn: Wait a minute!
MsgJp: 待ってよー！

MsgEn: Wait a minute!
MsgJp: 待ってよー！

MsgEn: Don't come over here!
MsgJp: こっち来ないでってば！

MsgEn: Go away!
MsgJp: あっち行きなさいよ！

MsgEn: I'm not delicious!
MsgJp: アタシ、おいしくないって！

MsgEn: What are you doing today?
MsgJp: 今日は何する？

MsgEn: What are you doing today?
MsgJp: 今日は何する？

MsgEn: What should I do?
MsgJp: どうしようか

MsgEn: What should I do?
MsgJp: どうしようか

MsgEn: Please...
MsgJp: お願い――

MsgEn: I was able to do everything I could do today. I would be happy if you could come again tomorrow!
MsgJp:
今日できることは全部やれたみたい
また明日も来てくれると嬉しいな！

MsgEn: Lorna and Brad, and even the soldiers in the fort, are helping with the restoration work!
MsgJp:
ローナやブラッド――
それに砦の兵隊さんまで
大食堂の修復手伝ってくれてるんだよ！

MsgEn: It feels like a 'team,' you know?
MsgJp: なんか“チーム”って感じだよね？

MsgEn: And you, of course!
MsgJp: もちろん、あなたも！

MsgEn: Ah! I want to name it.
MsgJp:
あ！
なんか名前付けたいなー

MsgEn: Hey! What would you like?
MsgJp:
ね！
何がいい？

MsgEn: The debris is still there, but the pantry is back up and running. It gives me strength!
MsgJp:
瓦礫はまだ残ってるけどさ
食料庫が復活しただけで
力が湧いてくるんだぁ

MsgEn:
Lorna, huh.
When asked where to fix it first,
I shouted loudly――
MsgJp:
ローナにね
最初にどこを直すか聞かれたから
でっかい声で――

MsgEn: "Food storage! Food storage is good!" - I shouted.
MsgJp:
「食料庫！　食料庫がいい！！」
――って叫んじゃった

MsgEn: The big dining hall is surrounded by walls, so it is suitable for protecting food, but...
MsgJp:
大食堂って壁に囲まれてるから
食料守るのには向いてるんだけど――

MsgEn:
When the cooking gets burned,
and the room becomes filled with smoke,
it even smells burnt inside the nose.
MsgJp:
お料理焦がしちゃったときとか
部屋中煙だらけになって
鼻の奥までコゲ臭くなるんだよね

MsgEn: Shall we discreetly make a hole in the wall so that we won't get caught?
MsgJp:
バレないように
壁にこっそり穴あけちゃおうかな？

MsgEn:
Peco seems to have decided to stay here forever.
Well, people who come to the cafeteria for the first time might be a little surprised, though.
MsgJp:
ペコ、ずっとここにいることにしたみたい
まぁ――初めて食堂に来た人は
ちょっとびっくりしてるけどね

MsgEn: She's a goblin, but she's strangely timid. As for me, it's easier for me to see her here doing well.
MsgJp:
あの子ってばゴブリンなのに
妙に気が弱かったりするからさ
アタシとしても、ここで元気にしてるの
見られる方が気が楽だよ

MsgEn: Since we've been back up and running, we've had all kinds of people coming in. It's kept us busy and buzzing. There's so much to do every day!
MsgJp:
復旧してから色んな人が来てくれるんだ
おかげで忙しくって、賑やかで
毎日やることだらけだよ

MsgEn: Heather and Aidan are also uplifting―― Peco has settled in too, and in a way, is doing something like work
MsgJp:
ヘザーとアイダンも盛り上げてくれるし――
ペコも居ついちゃって、何だか自分なりに
仕事みたいなことしてるしね

MsgEn: Alright, we need to push ourselves even harder, We have to get support from all the soldiers! From here on, let's restore Rath-- No, I want to bring back the vitality of all of Acre Selund!
MsgJp:
――さぁ、もっともっと頑張って
戦士のみんなに力付けてもらわないと！
ここからラスニテを――
ううん、アッカーシェランを元気にしていきたいんだ

MsgEn: The cafeteria is back to normal now! No, it might even be better than before. After all, we all built this cafeteria together!
MsgJp:
大食堂、もうすっかり元通りだよ！　
――ううん、元の大食堂よりも良い感じかも
何ていったって皆で作り上げた食堂だからね！

MsgEn:
You've helped me a lot.
Thanks to you, I've made it this far.
I'm very grateful!　Thank you so much!
MsgJp:
あなたにもいっぱい協力してもらったよね
お陰で、ここまでやってこれたこと
とっても感謝してる！　本当にありがとう！

MsgEn:
What do you like?
Do you have a taste for memories?
MsgJp:
あなたは何が好き？
思い出の味とか、あるでしょ？

MsgEn: U, uga?
MsgJp: ウ、ウガ？

MsgEn: Food and collectibles! Carrie, are you happy?
MsgJp:
食ベモノ、集めタ！
キャリーうれしい？

MsgEn: It's fun being here!
MsgJp: ココにいる、楽しイ！

MsgEn: Whoever is in the armor, if they show up in front of me, I'm just going to fight!
MsgJp:
誰モ、イジメナイ――
ペコ――悪いコト、シナイ

MsgEn: The next strategy is...shall we go this way... No, the other way around is better...
MsgJp:
次の作戦は――こっちでいくか
いやいや、逆にあっちの方が――

MsgEn: I often seem to be talking to myself, but I don't really feel it as much as everyone says.
MsgJp:
ボクは、よく独り言を言ってるらしいんだけど
みんなが言うほどの実感がなくってね

MsgEn: I usually don't pay much attention to whether someone is around me or not. It's just natural for me.
MsgJp:
普段から、まわりに誰かいるかとかは
特に気にしてはいないけど
ボクにとっては自然なことさ

MsgEn: This isn't just talking to myself, right?
MsgJp: ――これは、独り言じゃないよね？

MsgEn: Lookout Castle, isn't there a room for me there? Ah, well, it's because I had one made before.
MsgJp:
展望城に自分の部屋はないのかって？
ああ、それなら以前
一度作ってもらったことがあってね

MsgEn: But the castle is so big and complicated. I got tired of getting lost every time I went back to my room and realized I'd forgotten where I was.
MsgJp:
でも、城内って広くて複雑でさ
部屋に戻るたびに迷うのに飽きてしまって
気が付いたら場所を忘れてたんだよ

MsgEn: The only places I remember now are—the castle entrance, the royal layer, and the cafeteria with the stew!
MsgJp:
今覚えてる場所は――
城の入り口と、王宮層と
あとはシチューのある食堂だけさ！

MsgEn: I think that a strategy is like a living creature.
MsgJp: ボクは、作戦というものは“生き物”だと思ってる

MsgEn: No matter how perfectly you plan it in advance, it can change at any moment, and it's rare that things go the way you want them to.
MsgJp:
いくら事前に完璧に計画したつもりでも
その場の状況でいくらだって変わるし
思い通りに行く方が珍しいくらいさ

MsgEn: Well, that's the interesting part about it, you know? It's boring for everything to just go as you think.
MsgJp:
まぁ、そこが面白いところなんだけどね
何でも思った通りになるなんて
つまんないだろ？

MsgEn: Are you ready? Let's go.
MsgJp: 準備はいいかい？それじゃ行こう

MsgEn: Are you ready? Let's go.
MsgJp: 準備はいいかい？　それじゃ行こう

MsgEn: There's got to be something.
MsgJp: きっと、何かあるはずさ

MsgEn: There's got to be something.
MsgJp: きっと、何かあるはずさ

MsgEn: Hmmm... I see.
MsgJp: ふんふん、なるほどね

MsgEn: No, wait, could you?
MsgJp: いや、待てよ？

MsgEn: No, wait, could you?
MsgJp: いや、待てよ？

MsgEn: Ah, I see! So that's how it is! As I thought, I am a genius!
MsgJp:
そうか！　そういうことか！
やはり僕は、天才だね！

MsgEn: Hmm, that's strange... It seems like I'm feeling a little unwell today!
MsgJp:
おかしいなぁ――
今日はちょっと調子が悪いらしい！

MsgEn:
Hmm, that's strange...
It seems like I'm feeling a little unwell today!
MsgJp:
おかしいなぁ――
今日はちょっと調子が悪いらしい！

MsgEn: See, it's just as I thought, isn't it?
MsgJp: ほら、僕の思った通りだろう？

MsgEn: Hahaha! Sometimes things like this happen!
MsgJp:
はっはっは！
たまにはこんなこともあるさ！

MsgEn:
Hahaha!
Sometimes things like this happen!
MsgJp:
はっはっは！
たまにはこんなこともあるさ！

MsgEn: Oh, you, you.
MsgJp: あー、キミキミ

MsgEn: Oh, you, you
MsgJp: あー、キミキミ

MsgEn: Can I have a word with you?　Captain.
MsgJp: ちょっといいかな？　隊長

MsgEn: Can I have a word with you?　Captain.
MsgJp: ちょっといいかな？　隊長

MsgEn: Hmm, something is strange.
MsgJp: おかしいなぁ――

MsgEn: I am a genius, after all!
MsgJp: やはり僕は、天才だね！

MsgEn: Let's go then!
MsgJp: それじゃあ行こう！

MsgEn: There doesn't seem to be anything here anymore.
MsgJp: ここにはもう何もなさそうだ

MsgEn: Now, let's go home!
MsgJp: さて、帰るとしよう！

MsgEn: Oh, no—it's no use—
MsgJp: ああ、もう――だめだ――

MsgEn: Ahahaha!
MsgJp: アハハハ！

MsgEn: Ahahaha!
MsgJp: アハハハ！

MsgEn: Huh?!
MsgJp: んんっ！？

MsgEn: Huh?!
MsgJp: んんっ！？

MsgEn: Um...
MsgJp: えぇっと――

MsgEn: Ha~
MsgJp: はぁ～

MsgEn: Ha~
MsgJp: はぁ～

MsgEn: That—
MsgJp: あれ――

MsgEn: There doesn't seem to be anything else here. That's what my instincts are whispering to me, you know. Well, let's go home!
MsgJp:
ここにはもう何もなさそうだ
僕の勘がそう囁いているのでね
さて、帰るとしよう！

MsgEn: Great job! If we're together, we have no enemies, don't we?!
MsgJp:
やったね！
僕らがいれば敵無しなんじゃないか！？

MsgEn: Oh, sorry. There's something I need to think about right now. I'm busy.
MsgJp:
あー、ごめん
今ちょっと考えなきゃいけないことが
あってね、忙しいんだ

MsgEn: Thank you! I'm saved! Good job—
MsgJp:
ありがとう！　助かったよ！
よしよしこれで――

MsgEn: Is it already over? As expected, you're dependable!
MsgJp:
もう終わったの？
さすが、頼りになるね！

MsgEn: Now, what to do?
MsgJp: さて、何をする？

MsgEn: Now, what to do?
MsgJp: さて、何をする？

MsgEn: Hey
MsgJp: やあ

MsgEn: Hey
MsgJp: やあ

MsgEn: Nice to see you
MsgJp: よく来たね

MsgEn: Nice to see you
MsgJp: よく来たね

MsgEn: Ha ha! It's been a while since the last battle, it's taking a toll on my body
MsgJp: はあはあ、久しぶりの戦は体に応えるなぁ

MsgEn: Wait a moment, please let me take a short break.
MsgJp: ちょっと待った、少し休憩させてくれ

MsgEn: Oh, my body feels heavy. This is not how it should be.
MsgJp: あれ、体が重いぞ、こんなはずじゃあ

MsgEn: I think I'd rather be indoors, planning...
MsgJp: や、やっぱり僕は室内で策を練ってる方が――

MsgEn: I've become a little more mobile.
MsgJp: 少しは、動けるようになってきたぞ――

MsgEn: Ah, but I'm still hurting, I need a little break.
MsgJp: ああ、でもまだ苦しい、ちょっと休憩

MsgEn: How do I look now from your point of view?
MsgJp: キミから見て、今の僕ってどうかな？

MsgEn: I think I can do a little more -- no.
MsgJp: もうちょっと頑張れそうな気も――ううん

MsgEn: Ha-ha-ha, how's my movement, light, isn't it?
MsgJp: あははは、どうだい僕の動き、軽やかだろう？

MsgEn: Running like the wind, piercing like thunder!
MsgJp: 風のように走り、雷のように刺す！

MsgEn: No, I was just a little rusty before!
MsgJp: なに、前はちょっと腕が鈍ってただけさ！

MsgEn: Hehe, having a capable staff officer who can fight is nice, isn't it?
MsgJp: ふふ、戦える参謀官っていいよね

MsgEn: Wait, it was found!?
MsgJp: え、見つかった！？

MsgEn: As expected, Captain!
MsgJp: さすが隊長だ！

MsgEn: Ha-- You scared the hell out of me. What can I do for you?
MsgJp:
ハッ――
驚いた、何か用？

MsgEn: Sorry, I'm just not in the mood for pleasant small talk.
MsgJp: 悪いけど、楽しく世間話する気分じゃないんだ

MsgEn: Because of this situation ―― Just because I'm a child doesn't mean I don't understand anything.
MsgJp:
こんな状況だから――
子供だからって何もわからないわけじゃないよ

MsgEn: If things get worse... It might be difficult to survive. Can you run around and play at such times?
MsgJp:
もっと悪いことになったら
生きていくのが難しくなるかもしれない
そんな時に、走り回って遊べる？

MsgEn: Oh, thank you.
MsgJp: ああ、どうも

MsgEn: I wish I could lock myself in my house or hide in a cave, but that's not going to happen.
MsgJp:
家の中に閉じこもったり
洞窟に隠れたりできればいいんですが
そういうわけにもいかないでしょう

MsgEn: I had some business to attend to, and I left home with some degree of determination, but I underestimated it.
MsgJp:
ちょっとした用がありましてね
ある程度、覚悟して家を出てきたんです
――いや、甘かったです

MsgEn: There are some villages that still have merchants coming to them, but there are many small villages that don't, so we have to go out there and take the risk.
MsgJp:
今も商人が来てくれる村もありますが
そうじゃない小さな村もたくさんありますから
危険を承知で外に出ざるを得ないんです

MsgEn:
What? What did you say?
I'm sorry, I've been a little hard of hearing lately.
MsgJp:
え、なんだって？
すまないね、最近耳が遠くて――

MsgEn: The dragon has been defeated—To put it simply, only one event has occurred, resulting in this state.
MsgJp:
竜が倒された――
言ってしまえば、ただ一つの事件が
起こっただけで、この有様だ

MsgEn: If only we had protected the dragons and the royal family that follows them more, would it not have come to this?
MsgJp:
竜と――それに連なる王家を
もっと守っておけば
こうはならなかったのかね――

MsgEn: I don't know what the hell the people who served the royal family are doing. It's utterly pathetic.
MsgJp:
王家に仕えてた人たちは
一体何をしてるんだか
まったく情けない話だよ

MsgEn: Oh, are you an Arisen?
MsgJp: ふぅん、君が覚者ですか

MsgEn: -- I have to look at everything as an opportunity. It's a family tradition.
MsgJp:
――何でもチャンスとして見ないと
我が家の家訓でしてね

MsgEn: If you don't protect your own life, well, it can't be helped if you suffer the consequences.
MsgJp:
自分の暮らしは自分で守らないと、ですよ
そういった努力ができない者は
まぁ、痛い目を見ても――仕方ないのでは？

MsgEn: Our family has been networking and saving in case of an emergency, so if you haven't done those things, well, you're in a tough spot right now.
MsgJp:
我々の一族は、万が一の時のために
人脈を広げ、貯蓄してきましたから
そういったことをしていない人は
まぁ、今大変なんじゃないですか

MsgEn: Hello, umm, well...
MsgJp:
こんにちは
あのぅ、えっと――

MsgEn: What am I going to do now?
MsgJp: わたし、これからどうすればいいんでしょう

MsgEn: My mother told me to run away, so I came here...
MsgJp:
母に逃げてって言われたんです
それでここまで来たんです――

MsgEn: I'm a little tired...
MsgJp: ちょっと疲れちゃった――

MsgEn:
Huh? What is it?
